How to Join the Team

Are you a data analyst who loves uncovering insights, shaping strategy, and maybe even geeking out over flight simulation? Apply now as we will be reviewing applications on an on-going basis.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s # 1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.




We, in the Messaging team, own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.




As a Staff Data analyst in the Messaging team, you’ll be responsible for the team's quantitative insights. From understanding our data, identifying problems, to working with product, tech and design on hypothesizing solutions. You’ll be the driver of our experimentation and learning efforts. Messaging team sits at the very core of Truecaller experience, so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to work with other teams and the executives.




The impact you will create:

Understanding Truecaller's data, particularly related to the Messaging team.
Taking ownership of quantitative insights for the Messaging team, playing a crucial role in product development.
Defining experiments, overseeing their setup, and analyzing their results to drive decision-making.
Developing and maintaining key performance indicators (KPIs) for the team, ensuring their tracking, reliability, and reporting.
Creating data pipelines and dashboards to measure the team's KPIs and effectively communicate insights to both the team and leadership.
Coaching and mentoring the team on experimentation and data-driven product development processes, fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.




What you bring in:

6-10 years experience in Data Analytics
Experience in using SQL to extract, transform and analyse data
Experience in data visualisation tools like Looker (preferred), QlikSense, Tableau, or PowerBI
Experience in mentoring, coaching and evangelsing about data in product development
Experience in digging into different data sources to understand why specific customer behaviours happen
Fluent in spoken and written English




It would be great if you also have:

Big data query tools (we use BigQuery).
Experience with data from mobile applications.




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

  • Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
  • Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
  • A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


We, in the Messaging team, own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.


As a Staff Data analyst in the Messaging team, you’ll be responsible for the team's quantitative insights. From understanding our data, identifying problems, to working with product, tech and design on hypothesizing solutions. You’ll be the driver of our experimentation and learning efforts. Messaging team sits at the very core of Truecaller experience, so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to work with other teams and the executives.


The impact you will create:

  • Understanding Truecaller's data, particularly related to the Messaging team.
  • Taking ownership of quantitative insights for the Messaging team, playing a crucial role in product development.
  • Defining experiments, overseeing their setup, and analyzing their results to drive decision-making.
  • Developing and maintaining key performance indicators (KPIs) for the team, ensuring their tracking, reliability, and reporting.
  • Creating data pipelines and dashboards to measure the team's KPIs and effectively communicate insights to both the team and leadership.
  • Coaching and mentoring the team on experimentation and data-driven product development processes, fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.


What you bring in:

  • 6-10 years experience in Data Analytics
  • Experience in using SQL to extract, transform and analyse data
  • Experience in data visualisation tools like Looker (preferred), QlikSense, Tableau, or PowerBI
  • Experience in mentoring, coaching and evangelsing about data in product development
  • Experience in digging into different data sources to understand why specific customer behaviours happen
  • Fluent in spoken and written English


It would be great if you also have:

  • Big data query tools (we use BigQuery).
  • Experience with data from mobile applications.


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/


Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.


This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.


We only accept applications in English.


What we offer:

What we offer:

  • A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
  • A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
  • Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
  • Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Join our Battlefield Analytics team as a Senior Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of gaming! You'll drive key insights into the software and experiential quality of Battlefield, directly impacting player experiences.

In this role, you'll leverage your analytics skills to guide strategic decisions, ensuring our leaders prioritize data-driven choices for product optimization, gameplay features, technology advancements, testing processes, and overall game quality. Reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager, you'll be an integral part of our innovative analytics organization, making a tangible impact in the gaming world.

The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will develop business intelligence products and lead data projects to enhance data maturity for our Development and Quality Assurance teams. Your expertise in SQL, ETL pipelines, and data visualization will be crucial in analysing data and identifying trends to drive decision-making across the organization.


Report to the Senior Analytics Manager.
Influence the data analytics roadmap for major EA titles.
Develop data products to improve decision-making.
Establish best practices in data analytics and visualization.
Influencing data governance practices to enhance data maturity.
Provide coaching to Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Advanced Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


Benefits

We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match, and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes outstanding people to make outstanding games, we offer a culture that's motivated by creativity and individuality.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior (Staff) Data Analyst – Fintech | SQL, SAS Viya, Qlik

📍 Stockholm, Sweden | Hybrid | Some Travel Required




About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced and impact-driven Senior (Staff) Data Analyst to join a fast-growing Fintech headquartered in Stockholm. As the company builds a completely new data platform to support next-generation financial services, your work will directly shape how data powers products, decisions, and operations at scale.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone who combines strong technical expertise with business acumen and thrives in transformation-focused environments. The position offers a hybrid working model and some travel during the initial months for onboarding and collaboration.




What You’ll Do:

Serve as a senior analytical partner across product, tech, and operations teams
Design and execute high-value analyses using SQL, with experience in SAS Viya and Qlik as a strong plus
Support the development and implementation of a modern data platform to replace legacy systems
Translate complex business questions into clear, actionable insights
Build scalable dashboards, reports, and data models to guide strategic decisions
Drive data quality, governance, and consistency across domains
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to building a best-in-class analytics function




What We’re Looking For:

5+ years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, preferably in banking or financial services
Strong command of SQL and comfort working with large, complex datasets
Experience with SAS Viya and/or Qlik is highly advantageous
Strong communication skills and a proactive, business-oriented mindset
Experience living and working in Sweden over the past two years is preferred
Ability to travel as needed during the first few months (typically within Sweden)
Based in or willing to relocate to Stockholm, with hybrid work flexibility




Why Join Them?

They are not a traditional bank — they're building a next-gen Fintech platform that’s modern, data-driven, and customer-centric from the ground up. As part of this journey, you’ll help architect the future of financial services in the Nordics, with real ownership, purpose, and visibility across the company.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are looking for Data Modeler cum Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:

Analyst for Recovery Data monitoring reports in Information capability ART
Able to work independently with defined problems on an average
level within specific platform and competence area Experience
with developing IT solutions able to take partial responsibility for
minor projects Experience in requirements gathering data analysis
data modelling and provide input to solution design Good
knowledge of relevant tools and technology
Most important MODELLING EXPERIENCE




Mandatory Skills : Data Vault (ODS) Modeling, Dimensional Data Modeling, ER Studio, MS SQL Server

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill leda utvecklingen i branschen genom att driva förändring och arbetar aktivt för att minska vårt eget klimatavtryck, såväl som att hjälpa våra kunder att göra bättre och mer hållbara val utifrån sina förutsättningar. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!




Som ESG Data Analytiker hos OKQ8 kommer du att ingå i vårt Business Intelligence team som har en central roll i att förvalta och omvandla vår data till praktiska insikter.




Vi erbjuder en unik möjlighet att utöka din expertis inom ESG samt bli produktspecialist för vårt kommande SMS, Sustainability Management System. Detta är en specialistroll som ansvarar för att samla in, integrera, övervaka och rapportera kring ESG både internt och externt, samt säkra att vi lever upp till regelverk och organisatoriska mål.




Under de senaste åren har OKQ8 etablerat och rapporterat kring ett antal ESG-datapunkter (enligt GRI) samt genomfört en gapanalys gällandes de nya ESRS-upplysningarna som ingår i kommande CSRD rapportering.




Ansvarsområden

Bygga upp expertis och förstå affärsbehov relaterade till ESG-data
Leda och koordinera datainsamling tillsammans med dataägare från olika delar av organisationen. Samla in data från olika källor såsom Finans, Logistik, Drift och HR relaterad till utsläpp, mångfald och andra ESG-mått
Där det är möjligt, bistå i krav och utveckling kring IT-infrastruktur, inklusive definiera ESG-relaterade krav kring data
Säkerställa kvalitet, tillförlitlighet och tillgänglighet kring ESG-data
ESG-mått - Bistå dataägare med beräkningar och modeller
Analysera utveckling och trender kring ESG för att identifiera gap, risker och möjligheter




Vi söker

Vi ser gärna att du har ett par års erfarenhet i roller inom exempelvis hållbarhetsrapportering eller kring data som analytiker. Som person tror vi att du är fokuserad, lösningsorienterad och analytisk. Du kan arbeta självgående, har erfarenhet samt ett stort intresse kring hållbarhet.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har/är:




Kandidat- eller magisterexamen i ekonomi, hållbarhet, datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller ett närliggande område
Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska eller danska
Utmärkt analytisk och problemlösningsförmåga
God kommunikationsförmåga för att interagera med tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter




Meriterande kvalifikationer

Expertis inom CSRD, ESG-ramverk, hållbarhets-/klimatrapportering och regelefterlevnad
Erfarenhet av projektkoordinering eller att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team
Dokumenterad erfarenhet som BI/Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller liknande
Kunskap inom Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse eller Profisee
Kunskap inom programmeringsspråk såsom DAX, Python, R eller SQL

Vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka även om du inte känner att du uppfyller alla ovan nämnda kvalifikationer. Det viktigaste är att du har ett starkt driv, engagerad, skärpt och vill vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt!




Vi erbjuder

Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö där vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling. Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och möjligheten att vara en del av vår resa mot en mer hållbar framtid. Här får du växa, utmanas och göra verklig skillnad, samtidigt som vi stöttar varandra för att nå de bästa resultaten.




OKQ8 Scandinavia arbetar för att vara en jämställd arbetsplats med medarbetare som trivs och utvecklas och där olikheter uppmuntras. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som hjälper till att minska utanförskap och bidrar till mångfald.

I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.




Tjänstepension
Möjlighet till ersättning vid föräldraledighet
3 extra klämdagar varje år
Personalerbjudanden i förmånsportalen
4000kr i friskvårdsbidrag
Fri läkarvård upp till högkostnadsskyddet




Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.

Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Business Performance
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Business Performance Analytics team




The Business Performance Analytics team supports key business stakeholders such as Operations, Commercial, and Finance. Our mission is to empower data-driven decision-making by delivering actionable insights that drive merchant growth, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency. We continuously strive to improve analytics capabilities, optimize resources, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.




About the role




As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with an analytical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our Data Foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data platform that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Take full ownership of end-to-end analytical projects, from defining objectives with stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Collaborate closely with the Data Foundation team to ensure the reliability and scalability of our data infrastructure
Continuously and proactively identify opportunities to improve our analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly
Communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who you are
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in the analytics field; Experience within payments, fintech, or a high-growth tech company is a plus 
Strong ability to work independently and take ownership of complex analytical challenges
Solid and broad analytical skill set
Advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
Experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense or Tableau
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Thrives in a fast-growing, dynamic environment and enjoys working cross-functionally








Our Fantastic Benefits

🌴 20 to 30 days of holiday (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance

🥳 Monthly team outing allowance to enjoy social events with your colleagues

👶 Parental leave top-up additional support for new parents

🥐 Daily breakfast and on-site perks to make your workday smoother

💚 Well being support our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best

PLUS additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!




Shape Your Role and Make an Impact

Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and submit your CV in English.

HTML:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.


About the Business Performance Analytics team


The Business Performance Analytics team supports key business stakeholders such as Operations, Commercial, and Finance. Our mission is to empower data-driven decision-making by delivering actionable insights that drive merchant growth, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency. We continuously strive to improve analytics capabilities, optimize resources, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.


About the role


As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with an analytical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our Data Foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data platform that will support the analytics needs.


What you’ll do
  • Take full ownership of end-to-end analytical projects, from defining objectives with stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
  • Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
  • Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
  • Collaborate closely with the Data Foundation team to ensure the reliability and scalability of our data infrastructure
  • Continuously and proactively identify opportunities to improve our analytics capabilities 
  • Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly
  • Communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Who you are
  • Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field
  • At least 3 years of experience in the analytics field; Experience within payments, fintech, or a high-growth tech company is a plus 
  • Strong ability to work independently and take ownership of complex analytical challenges
  • Solid and broad analytical skill set
  • Advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
  • Experience with BI tools such as Qlik Sense or Tableau
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Thrives in a fast-growing, dynamic environment and enjoys working cross-functionally



Our Fantastic Benefits

🌴 20 to 30 days of holiday (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance

🥳 Monthly team outing allowance to enjoy social events with your colleagues

👶 Parental leave top-up additional support for new parents

🥐 Daily breakfast and on-site perks to make your workday smoother

💚 Well being support our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best

PLUS additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!


Shape Your Role and Make an Impact

Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and submit your CV in English.

Title: Data Modeling Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Modeler / Data Modeling Analyst

Location: Stockholm, Sweden / Copenhagen, Denmark (Hybrid)

Job Type: Permanent / FTC




Job Description:




Create and maintain conceptual logical and physical data models for databases and data warehouses




Optimize data structures for performance scalability and reliability

Work closely with business analysts data architects and software developers to understand data needs

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data related projects

Define database structures to support business operations and analytics

Develop and maintain data dictionaries and metadata

Provide guidance on data storage solutions e g hive or cloud based databases

Ensure data models align with organizational standards and governance policies

Identify and resolve data inconsistencies and redundancy

Document all data models and ensure they are up to date

Develop and enforce data modeling best practices and standards

Use data modeling tools such as Erwin or IBM Data Architect to create models

Implement data solutions on platforms like Hadoop or Hive tables

Analyze data models for performance bottlenecks and recommend optimizations

Required Skills and Qualifications

Education Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science Information Systems Data Science or a related field

Experience Proven experience in data modeling database design or related roles

Technical Skills

Proficiency in data modeling tools e g Erwin IBM Data Architect

Expertise in Big data database systems e g Hive Impala

Expertise in Relational database systems e g Oracle

Familiarity with ETL processes data warehousing and cloud technologies

Knowledge Areas

Data governance frameworks and best practices

Advanced knowledge of normalization denormalization and schema design patterns

Understanding of modern data architectures such as data lakes and lakehouses

Soft Skills

Strong analytical and problem solving abilities

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Ability to work collaboratively across teams




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with big data technologies e g Hadoop Spark




Skills




Mandatory Skills : Data Vault (ODS) Modeling, Dimensional Data Modeling, ER Studio, MS SQL Server

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Data Quality Control Analyst
Description:
Media help partners understand the changing advertising landscape. Specialising in audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media, their global coverage and local expertise enable better understanding of media audiences and their relationships with brands.

Kantar Media is a wholly owned but operationally independent part of the Kantar Group.

Job Details

As people increasingly move across channels and platforms, Kantar Media’s data and audience measurement, targeting, analytics and advertising intelligence services unlock insights to inform powerful decision-making.

Working with panel and first-party data in over 80 countries, we have the world’s fastest growing cross-media measurement footprint, underpinned by versatility, scale, technology and expertise, to drive long-term business growth for our clients and partners.

Our versatility, scale, technology, and expertise enable our 5000 people across Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia Pacific, North America, and Africa to understand audiences and help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow

Location: Stockholm

Role Description

Excitingly Kantar Media has partnered with the MMS to build a new Cross-Media Measurement panel in Sweden, that will be one of the first of its kind in the world. We are looking for forward-thinking, diverse, and client-focused individuals to join our team and make this audience measurement panel a success for MMS and Kantar Media.

We have a vacancy for a Data Quality Control Analyst. You will supervise and maintain the quality of the panel as well as the data which should be delivered to clients daily.

As a Data Quality Engineer, you will analyze data throughout the entire data processing pipeline. This process starts inside the individual meters, installed in panelists’ homes, and ends at the point where data is delivered to the clients. You will investigate issues or weaknesses in this process and resolve them by implementing direct fixes or developing tools or analyses. These can be used by yourself or other members of the Kantar Media team to generate insights which contribute to improving or maintaining the quality of the panel and the data it produces. You will be included in setting up an exciting and large project from scratch. Therefore, we are looking for a professional who is eager to help build this project using innovative tooling in an international, data-driven organization.

Tasks And Responsibilities


Validate the quality of data produced by deployed systems by comparing data, generating metrics and calculating statistics.
Build complete understanding of the data structure at each step of the generation process and the edits which happen between these steps to ultimately generate the delivery data.
Design, develop, test and maintain data analysis pipelines for automated checking of data.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in data generation process to ensure correct and consistent data quality and integrity.
Configure and implement new features in the data without disrupting the existing structure.
Combine and organize data from different sources (Azure Blob Storage, SQL, APIs among others) to help generate valuable insights.
Create impactful visualizations and interactive tools using Power BI, Databricks, or equivalent solutions, both for your own use as well as to be used by others.
Demonstrate strong communication skills, conveying intricate technical concepts effectively.
Exhibit trustworthiness, resilience, and a quick-learning aptitude.
Demonstrate flexibility in taking on various tasks and adapting to changing priorities.


Required


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Writing Python, R or Scala scripts for data analysis and automation solutions.
SQL programming for effective data combination and acquisition.
Cloud environment (Azure).
Industry big data platform stack (Databricks, Spark)
Data visualization and dashboarding (Python, R, Power BI, Databricks)
Analytical and creative problem solving skills for effective troubleshooting of data issues.


Good To Have


Advanced statistics and machine Learning skills
Azure and DevOps Knowledge
Advanced Excel skills


At Kantar Media we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

At Kantar Media, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate based on age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Interested? Apply today or get in contact with maria.bonal@kantar.com to learn more.

Country

Sweden

Why join Kantar?

We pride ourselves on understanding people, and what makes us think and act the way we do.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst med Arkitektfokus
Description:
Tycker du också att åsikter kräver insikter? Att viktiga affärsbeslut ska tas med analys och data som underlag? Är du en analytisk problemlösare som är van att arbeta med och visualisera stora datamängder? Kom och joina oss som Data Analyst på ICA Sverige!

Det här är ditt blivande jobb

Teamet du kommer jobba i består av ca 30 fantastiska kollegor och tillhör vår Data & Analytics funktion i Solna, men du kommer också arbeta i ett leveransteam med mixade data & analytics roller där man tillsammans stöttar ett av ICAs sponsorsområden.

Du som Data Analyst med arkitektfokus utgör en kritisk faktor när vi nu tar ICAs datadrivna arbete till nya nivåer och tvärs hela bolaget. I den här tjänsten kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och utvecklas inom analytiska metoder tillsammans med skickliga, likasinnade kollegor.

I denna roll kommer du att fungera som en viktig länk mellan våra dataanalytiker och arkitekter. Du kommer att arbeta både hands-on som dataanalytiker i ett av våra produktteam och samtidigt arbeta som arkitekt med fokus på vårt analyslager. Du kommer att leda initiativ som främjar gemensamma arbetssätt inom dataanalytikergruppen, förbättrad prestanda och tekniska vägval vid nya use case.

Vem är du?

Vi söker just nu en Data Analyst som har flera års erfarenhet i en liknande roll och som har jobbat med modellering och arkitektfrågor. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av och är trygg med att utveckla i SQL och är van att arbeta med stora datamängder och kombinerar data från olika källor. Vi jobbar med Tableau så vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av den, eller en liknande BI visualiseringsverktyg och någon molnlösning. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av GCP, Looker, DBT, GitHub, BigQuery och Python.

För att trivas på ICA ser vi att du är en affärsmässig och ansvarstagande person som har en god förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och inta ett helikopterperspektiv. Du har lätt för att inspirera och coacha andra i det du brinner för - data data data! För dig är ingen fråga för stor eller för liten och du räds inte att själv söka svar på frågor i de djupaste av datalager.

För att vara aktuell för denna roll måste du tala svenska och engelska obehindrat.

Kontaktinformation

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Magnus Gidlund på 072 220 02 93, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Bojana Mijocevic tel 076-695 15 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 2025-06-01.

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet.
Show more

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Magnus Gidlund på 072 220 02 93, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Bojana Mijocevic tel 076-695 15 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 2025-06-01.

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet.

Title: Affärsutvecklare
Description:
Är du en affärsutvecklare med spetskompetens inom data och analys som förstår och värdesätter kundens behov? I denna roll kommer du att driva kundutvecklingsinitiativ tvärs LFs affärer med fokus på analys och visualisering av data

Om jobbet

Vi söker en passionerad och analytisk affärsutvecklare som vill och kan stärka data - och analysförmågan i vårt uppdrag. Gruppens uppdrag är att med utgångspunkt i kund – och medarbetarbehov driva initiativ tvärs LFs affärer för ett stärkt helhetserbjudande och ökad affärsnytta. Det ingår att utveckla och implementera nya koncept och erbjudanden som träffar kund, leda och driva plan – och målbildsarbeten samt att bidra till och driva möjliggörande utveckling.

I denna roll kommer du att:


Driva framtagande av initiala Business case för validering av potential och underlag för beslut.
Skapa, vidareutveckla och analysera beslutsunderlag för att underlätta strategiska beslut.
Koordinera, sammanställa och presentera mötesmaterial till olika beslutande forum och grupperingar.
Tolka och visualisera information för att enkelt kravställa och samarbeta med vår analysavdelning.
Göra datauttag från olika källor och tolka, sammanställa visualisera samt presentera det på ett begripligt sätt för verksamhet och affär. Exempelvis med hjälp av Power BI eller liknande.
Stötta gruppen med analyser och KPI:er för gruppens prioriterade initiativ och utvecklingsarbeten.


Vem är du?

För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:


Flerårig erfarenhet som affärskonsult, analytiker eller affärsutvecklare.
God förmåga att skapa strukturerat och kommunikativt material/underlag.
Goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office-paketet (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Vana och förståelse för data och siffror.
Erfarenhet av arbete med dataanalys, gärna av bank- och försäkringsdata.
Erfarenhet av effekthemtagning för projekt/initiativ.
Erfarenhet att omvandla kundbehov till faktisk kundnytta.


Som person är du affärsmässig och empatisk med en naturlig förmåga att enkelt framföra dina tankar och idéer. Du är prestigelös i samarbete, bidrar med ditt perspektiv och tar till dig av andras och är övertygad om att teamet ger den bästa lösningen. Du är lösningsorienterad, blickar ständigt framåt och inspirerar med din positiva attityd. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i komplexa utmaningar och leverera resultat med ditt strategiska och analytiska tänkande. Du agerar proaktivt med stort eget driv och har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både skriftligt och muntligt.

Om oss

Välkommen till Affärsenhet Sak inom Länsförsäkringar AB! Vi ansvarar för service och utveckling av länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär samt för att starta och driva ny affär. Enheten kompletterar länsförsäkringsbolagens erbjudande med specialprodukter för att möta kundens behov och ansvarar även för gemensamma koncept och erbjudanden samt för gemensam kundkommunikation och digital marknadsföring. Affärsenhet Sak ska bidra till att Länsförsäkringar är ledande inom sakförsäkring.

Vår grupp består av engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Vi värdesätter samarbete, kreativitet och en positiv arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas och växa i din roll, samtidigt som du bidrar till vår gemensamma framgång.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-30

Title: Digital Traffic & Conversion Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We are looking for a data-driven and results-oriented Digital Traffic & Conversion Analyst to join our team at Barnebys. In this role, you will be responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing traffic and conversions, for both B2B and B2C, and ensuring good user experience for our visitors. You will also own the analysis of visitor data, engagement patterns, and site-wide trends to provide insights that enhance the overall user experience and drive business growth.




Key Responsibilities

Track, manage, and optimize traffic flow and conversions across Barnebys, ensuring traffic acquisition objectives are met.
Monitor and report on campaign performance (organic, paid, and referral traffic), providing actionable insights to internal teams and clients.
Analyze visitor behavior and engagement across the platform to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track site-wide traffic, conversion rates, and user engagement metrics.
Provide strategic recommendations for increasing qualified traffic and improving conversion rates across Barnebys' channels
Conduct A/B testing and other optimization experiments to enhance user experience and boost engagement.
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in digital marketing, analytics, and user behavior.




Requirements

Proven experience in web analytics, traffic analysis, and conversion optimization (2-4+ years preferred).
Strong understanding of website performance metrics and key conversion KPIs.
Proficiency with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and similar platforms.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for both internal stakeholders and clients.
Familiarity with SEO, SEM, and digital marketing strategies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented, analytical mindset with a passion for continuous optimization and improvement.




What We Offer

A dynamic, collaborative work environment at the intersection of design, auctions, and technology.
Opportunities to work with leading auction houses, galleries, and dealers from around the world.
The chance to make a real impact on client success and user experience.




Working Location

We value in-person collaboration and expect regular presence at the office in the city center of Stockholm.




About Barnebys

At Barnebys, we're not just changing the auction industry – we're revolutionizing it. As a cutting-edge tech company and an independent market place, we're building a world-class ecosystem for art, antiques, and collectibles, and we need passionate, talented individuals to help us shape the future.




Our platform supports every step of the auction process – from registration to bidding and is trusted by industry leaders. With over 600,000 items available for sale, a comprehensive database of auction results, and powerful valuation tools, we are the go-to solution for collectors, galleries, and auction houses worldwide.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Vi söker en driven Data Quality Analyst till området Data Quality inom Wholesale Solutions med inriktning på Spårbarhet.

Vi söker dig som brinner för masterdatafrågor och som har dokumenterad erfarenhet från tidigare arbete inom Masterdata där du haft en senior roll. Vidare tror vi att du har förståelse och intresse för datakvalitet och betydelsen av data i flödeskedjan tvärs organisationer samt förstår samspelet mellan verksamheten och IT-stöd. Du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.

Som Data Quality Analyst är du driven och har lätt för att samarbeta och har förmågan att representera Data Quality i stora projekt som har påverkan på Masterdata inom ICA. Kompetens inom spårbarhetsområdet är önskvärt men inget krav.

Vi ser även att du använder självledarskapet i vardagen och är förändringsbenägen med ett fokus på att ständigt förbättra arbetssätt och processer.

Så här arbetar en Data Quaity Analyst

Förvalta, utveckla och säkerställa hög kvalitet i masterdataprocesser utifrån ett dataperspektiv samt de data assets som faller inom rollens ansvar.

I samarbete med verksamheten och Digital & Technology samla in och hantera krav för de tekniska och funktionella lösningar som återfinns inom ICAs masterdataprocesser.

Initiera förändringar och driva ständiga förbättringar av masterdatas dataprocesser och masterdatahantering.

Tillsammans med Data Quality Key User och Digital & Technology hantera avancerad felsökning och komplicerad utredning av incidenter gällande data assets, processer och verktyg.

Säkra att relevant dokumentation av dataprocess skapas och löpande underhålls, samt att kontinuerliga utbildningsåtgärder verkar för att tillgodose verksamhetens behov av kompetens inom masterdataområdet.

Tillföra hög masterdatakompetens i projekt och arbetsgrupper som kräver avancerad kompetens inom data och därmed säkra att förändrade eller nyutvecklade masterdataprocesser eller verktyg verkar för ”Best Practice” inom Masterdata Management.

Tillsammans med andra Masterdataexperter säkra effektivt utnyttjande av tillgängliga standarder och uppsatta policys för hantering av ICAs masterdata.

Via ett engagerat självledarskap och nyfikenhet verka för att rollens kompetens ligger i linje med ICAs aktuella behov på kort och lång sikt.

Vad händer nu?

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande, så du är välkommen att skicka in din ansökan omgående. Vi reserverar oss för att tillsättning av tjänsten kan ske innan sista dagen för ansökan går ut.

Anställning:

Tillsvidare med tillträde snarast

Placeringsort:

Solna/Göteborg/Helsingborg

Kontaktperson:

Kajsa Fägerblad Area Manager Data Quality, ICA Sverige AB, tfn: +46722202154

Sista dag för ansökan:

2025-05-25

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.
Show more

Title: Sustainability Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Sustainability Analyst you will report to our Head of Sustainability and collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the development and implementation of our global sustainability strategy and communication, work proactively to ensure sustainability performance and compliance with environmental regulations and industry standards, and contribute to building the Voi brand sustainability content. This will include:




Sustainability strategy: Collaborate closely with the Head of Sustainability and other colleagues to define and implement Voi’s sustainability strategy, including optimising resource use to reduce environmental impact, and drive progress to position Voi as a global leader in sustainability.
Monitoring & supporting change: Work continuously to stay up to date on sustainability related regulations, industry peer activity, academic research, assess risk associated with the sustainability goals, and initiate and support change initiatives to achieve key sustainability goals.
Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g. carbon emissions, energy consumption and waste management, ensuring transparency, traceability, accountability and compliance with regulations, e.g. CSRD, CBAM and the EU taxonomy.
Analysis & reporting: Analyse data and develop recommendations for sustainability management and sustainability performance reports.
Communication: Support the sustainability-, tender-, investor relations- and marketing teams in crafting and delivering the Voi sustainability narrative based on the strategic sustainability direction and progress.




WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK

We’re looking for an analytical, thorough and solution oriented sustainability professional, with the ability to manage and sanity check large data sets, and collaborate efficiently with diverse stakeholders. Apart from being fluent in English, self-sufficient and goal-oriented, we believe the right person has:




B.Sc. in Engineering or Business, preferably with a sustainability specialisation
Experience from management consulting, sustainability consulting or a similar position in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Experience from managing data collection, data analysis and projects with multiple stakeholders
Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, experience using SQL and python is a merit
Experience of sustainability-, CSR or ESG controlling/reporting, industry standards (e.g. GRI, CSRD) and environmental management system (e.g.ISO 14001) is a merit
Experience with sustainable procurement and audits of external suppliers is a merit




WHY VOI?

Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:




Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution




Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.




Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Show more

  • Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
  • Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
  • Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
  • Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.


Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst till vårt specialistnätverk!




Är du en BI-Analytiker som omvandlar data till strategiska insikter? Vi bygger nu ett nätverk för spännande uppdrag hos ledande företag i Sverige.




I dagens datadrivna affärsvärld är förmågan att effektivt samla in, analysera och presentera data avgörande för framgång. Företag inom olika branscher söker efter kvalificerade Business Intelligence Analysts, som kan hjälpa dem att förstå sin verksamhet bättre, identifiera trender, optimera processer och fatta välgrundade beslut.




Ditt fokus:

🔹 Driva ETL-processer & säkerställa datakvalitet.

🔹 Generera affärskritiska insikter via avancerad dataanalys.

🔹 Skapa & förvalta dashboards/rapporter (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik etc.).

🔹 Omvandla data till handlingsbara rekommendationer.




Vi söker dig med:

Gedigen BI-erfarenhet, stark SQL-kompetens, vana vid BI-verktyg (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik m.fl.) samt god affärs- och kommunikationsförmåga. Du är analytisk, självgående och lösningsorienterad. Akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik, ekonomi eller ingenjörsvetenskap.




Läs mer på www.interimmarketing.se




Bli en del av vårt nätverk – för din framtida karriär:

Genom att registrera ditt intresse hos oss får du möjlighet att bli matchad mot spännande uppdrag och permanenta positioner som överensstämmer med din profil och dina ambitioner när rätt tillfälle uppstår.




Är du redo att ta nästa steg?

Anslut dig till vårt specialistnätverk genom att skicka in ditt CV och gärna ett personligt brev via den gröna knappen "Ansök" i slutet av annonsen på vår hemsida www.interimmarketing.se. Du landar där när du klickar på "Ansök". Du kan också ansöka enkelt med hjälp av din LinkedIn-profil . Vi behandlar din information konfidentiellt och kontaktar dig när relevanta möjligheter dyker upp. Varmt Välkommen till vårt kandidatnätverk!




Om Interim Marketing Solutions RBS AB

Vi hjälper företag med kompetensförsörjning, både interim, rekrytering och omställning, av så väl chefer som specialister. Vi har själva både erfarenhet av eget arbete i linjebefattningar och som interimskonsult.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently building a Global Data Science team for a Global Infectious Disease company. We are looking for 2 Data Science Contractors to help support the project.




You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality and cleansing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 2 - 3 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools.

Show more

You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze raw data: assessing quality and cleansing
  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
  • Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
  • Generate actionable insights for business improvements


Qualifications


  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • At least 2 - 3 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
  • Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
  • Fluency in a programming language (Python)
  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools.

Title: Data engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Design and implement scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Collaborate with data analysts and scientists to understand data requirements and deliver working solutions for production.
Ensure data quality and integrity
Optimize data storage and retrieval for performance and cost-efficiency.
Provide technical expertise and support to team members and stakeholders.


Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience working with both data engineering and data science
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and data warehousing solutions.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Skills and experience in working with time-series data and time-series databases such as influxDB or Timebase
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and frameworks.
Skills in developing models to forecast future trends based on historical data.
Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations.
Basic understanding of web applications and REST APIs


Application deadline: 16-05-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla Skandiabankens Data Warehouse och forma framtidens datadrivna lösningar? Vi söker en Data Engineer som vill arbeta i ett engagerat team där samarbete, framdrift och lärande står i centrum. Här får du möjligheten att driva utvecklingen med en avancerad datahantering i en Microsoft-miljö. Låter det som något för dig? Ansök då rollen redan idag!

Att jobba som Data Engineer

Som Data Engineer på Skandiabanken kommer du att vara en central del av vårt team som utvecklar vårt nya Data Warehouse. Arbetet består av att lyfta lösningen till en ny bankgemensam dataplattform on-prem och förbereder för en framtida molnförflyttning. Likväl kommer du vara med att underhålla och drifta befintlig lösning. Du kommer att bygga och optimera data pipelines samt säkerställa att vår datahantering är både effektiv och säker. Rollen innebär att du kommer få jobba tätt tillsammans med verksamheten för att tillmötesgå deras behov. Du förväntas att även coacha och utbilda juniora kollegor.

Teamet består idag av Data Engineers, Produktägare och Lösningsarkitekt, där alla sitter på kontoret vid Lindhagensgatan 86 i Stockholm. Vi som team kännetecknas av en hög framdrift där stor vikt läggs vid samarbete för att lyckas. Vi lär av varandra genom kontinuerliga workshops och uppmuntrar en kultur där vi vågar lyfta idéer, litar på varandra och utvecklas tillsammans. Vi är ett agilt team som jobbar enligt SAFe metoden.

Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till vår gruppchef inom Data & Analytics inom Skandiabanken.

,

För att lyckas i rollen

Vi ser att du som person är stöttande, samarbetsvillig och trivs i en miljö där teamwork står i centrum. Du har ett driv och målmedvetenhet att utveckla både dig själv och andra. För att lyckas så är det naturligt att vara kommunikativ och ha en tillit till varandra för att bygga ett starkt team.

Du har mångårig erfarenhet inom Data Warehouse-utveckling i en on-prem Microsoft-miljö. Dessutom har du har god förståelse och kunskap inom datamodellering och ETL-utveckling. Rollen kräver att du kan svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.

Det är meriterande men ingen nödvändighet om du har arbetat med Data Vault och har erfarenhet av DWA-verktyg.

Vad händer nu?

Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet.

För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester via Alva Labs, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.

Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Markus Lundholm på markus.lundholm@skandia.se.

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen maila harald.brehmer@skandia.se.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Mer om Banken

Vi har varit pionjärer inom digital bankverksamhet sedan starten 1994, som Sveriges första helt digitala bank. Med en passion för innovation och kundfokus har vi vuxit till att erbjuda ett brett utbud av produkter och tjänster inom områdena Låna, Spara och Betala – med särskilt fokus på bolån.

Vår verksamhet är fördelad mellan Stockholm och Linköping. I Stockholm finns majoriteten av vår verksamhet, medan vår kundservice har sitt hjärta i Linköping. Tillsammans är vi cirka 270 medarbetare anställda på banken som varje dag skapar smarta lösningar för våra kunder.

Vårt erbjudande inkluderar:


Låna: Transparenta och attraktivt prissatta bolån
Spara: Sparande i fonder och aktier samt på sparkonto
Betala: Lönekonto samt smidiga kort- och betalningstjänster. Vi tror på att människor som utvecklas, presterar och mår bra är nyckeln till framgång. Hos oss är kompetensutveckling och lärande självklara delar av vardagen – framåt tillsammans!


Show more
