Vårt erbjudande inkluderar:

  • Låna: Transparenta och attraktivt prissatta bolån
  • Spara: Sparande i fonder och aktier samt på sparkonto
  • Betala: Lönekonto samt smidiga kort- och betalningstjänster. Vi tror på att människor som utvecklas, presterar och mår bra är nyckeln till framgång. Hos oss är kompetensutveckling och lärande självklara delar av vardagen – framåt tillsammans!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.

Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.

Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.

Be a productive member of the team.




Requirements


5+ years as a Data Engineer

Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze business needs and deliver effective, scalable data solutions

Implement data governance and quality standards to maintain data accuracy and integrity

Manage and optimize data platforms, databases, and data warehouses to support advanced analytics initiatives

Diagnose and resolve issues in real-time and batch data pipelines, ensuring seamless data integration across systems

Proficient in PySpark and Apache Airflow

Working knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Advanced expertise in Oracle and PL/SQL

Proficient in Unix environments

Familiar with GitHub Actions and JFrog for automated deployment




Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.

Opportunities for learning where needed.

Show more
HTML:
• Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
  • Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
  • Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
  • Be a productive member of the team.



Requirements

  • 5+ years as a Data Engineer
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze business needs and deliver effective, scalable data solutions
  • Implement data governance and quality standards to maintain data accuracy and integrity
  • Manage and optimize data platforms, databases, and data warehouses to support advanced analytics initiatives
  • Diagnose and resolve issues in real-time and batch data pipelines, ensuring seamless data integration across systems
  • Proficient in PySpark and Apache Airflow
  • Working knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
  • Advanced expertise in Oracle and PL/SQL
  • Proficient in Unix environments
  • Familiar with GitHub Actions and JFrog for automated deployment



Benefits

  • A challenging, innovating environment.
  • Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: SQL utvecklare
Description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla ett centralt datalager tillsammans med ett team där du har möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad? Vi söker nu en SQL utvecklare som kan vara med och vidareutveckla vårt data warehouse inom liv och pensionsförsäkring. Låter det som en plats där du skulle trivas och växa? Då är det dags att söka denna roll redan idag!

Att jobba som SQL utvecklare

Som SQL utvecklare hos Skandia kommer du att vara en del av ett team på fyra personer bestående av Scrum Master, SQL utvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekt och systemansvarig. Teamet har det övergripande ansvaret för vårt datalager och informationsförsörjning. I rollen kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förvalta vår SQL server lösningar och vårt data warehouse inom liv och pensionsförsäkringsområdet.

Du kommer att vara involverad i hela kedjan från datainhämtning och ETL-flöden till transformation och visualisering. Arbetet innebär tätt samarbete med såväl IT som verksamheten. Då teamet är litet ges du även mycket eget ansvar och stora möjligheter att påverka både tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt framåt. Tillsammans sitter vi på vårt kontor i Stockholm på Kungsholmen.

Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till vår gruppchef inom IT BI & Information.

,

För att lyckas i rollen

Som person tror vi att du vill vara en del av ett team där samarbete och kommunikation står i fokus. Du är prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra. Likaså har du ett eget driv och förmåga att ta egna initiativ för att både utveckla dig själv och andra.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har några års arbetserfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server. Jobbat med ETL flöden gärna med SSIS. Samtidigt har du kunskap inom datatransformering samt kan flytande svenska både i tal och skrift.

Vad händer nu?

Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer processen att innefatta intervjuer, tester via Alva Labs, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.

Om du har frågor om rollen, vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på fredrik.othberg@skandia.se.

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquistion Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Mer om IT

Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen.

Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Var 12:e vecka samlas vi i vår inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för två planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av sex tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista är en innovationssprint – en chans att utveckla och förfina våra system.

Vill du vara med på vår resa? Välkommen till Skandia IT!


Show more
HTML:
Vill du vara med och utveckla ett centralt datalager tillsammans med ett team där du har möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad? Vi söker nu en SQL utvecklare som kan vara med och vidareutveckla vårt data warehouse inom liv och pensionsförsäkring. Låter det som en plats där du skulle trivas och växa? Då är det dags att söka denna roll redan idag!

Att jobba som SQL utvecklare

Som SQL utvecklare hos Skandia kommer du att vara en del av ett team på fyra personer bestående av Scrum Master, SQL utvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekt och systemansvarig. Teamet har det övergripande ansvaret för vårt datalager och informationsförsörjning. I rollen kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förvalta vår SQL server lösningar och vårt data warehouse inom liv och pensionsförsäkringsområdet.

Du kommer att vara involverad i hela kedjan från datainhämtning och ETL-flöden till transformation och visualisering. Arbetet innebär tätt samarbete med såväl IT som verksamheten. Då teamet är litet ges du även mycket eget ansvar och stora möjligheter att påverka både tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt framåt. Tillsammans sitter vi på vårt kontor i Stockholm på Kungsholmen.

Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till vår gruppchef inom IT BI & Information.

,

För att lyckas i rollen

Som person tror vi att du vill vara en del av ett team där samarbete och kommunikation står i fokus. Du är prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra. Likaså har du ett eget driv och förmåga att ta egna initiativ för att både utveckla dig själv och andra.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har några års arbetserfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server. Jobbat med ETL flöden gärna med SSIS. Samtidigt har du kunskap inom datatransformering samt kan flytande svenska både i tal och skrift.

Vad händer nu?

Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer processen att innefatta intervjuer, tester via Alva Labs, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.

Om du har frågor om rollen, vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på fredrik.othberg@skandia.se.

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquistion Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Mer om IT

Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen.

Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Var 12:e vecka samlas vi i vår inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för två planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av sex tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista är en innovationssprint – en chans att utveckla och förfina våra system.

Vill du vara med på vår resa? Välkommen till Skandia IT!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description




You and your skills

The ideal candidate will possess not only extensive experience with the data engineering technologies we use, but also a high level of proficiency in soft skills.

Technical Responsibilities:

• Implement tooling, develop data pipelines, and deliver data governance solutions.

• Build and maintain streaming solutions using Kafka—previous experience with Kafka is essential.

• Work extensively with Snowflake to expose data for analytical purposes, including handling access controls and ensuring data protection.

• Operate within our core tech stack, which includes Azure, Azure Data Factory (ADF), Kafka, Apache Airflow, SQL, Python, Snowflake, and DBT. Hands-on experience with these technologies is required.

• Collaborate on system integrations, including connecting various internal and external data sources and APIs, ensuring end-to-end data flow and quality.

• Be open and adaptable to handling vague or evolving technical requirements, and provide solutions in ambiguous scenarios.

Additional Technical Skills (Preferred but Not Required):

• Knowledge of backend languages such as .NET or Java is a plus, particularly in the context of integrating with enterprise systems or building custom connectors.

Soft Skills & Collaboration:

• Be a collaborative team player who is adaptable, open to change, and enthusiastic about learning.

• Demonstrate strong communication and stakeholder management skills, working closely with both product teams and data consumers.

• Understand stakeholder needs and translate them into effective data solutions.

• Collaborate actively with the Commercial Data Hub and data-producing teams to ensure data is accessible, reliable, and usable across the organization.

Title: Data & Analytics lead, Auctionet
Description:
Auctionet is looking for a Data & Analytics lead to build our data-driven culture through analytics, machine learning, and BI. You'll develop tools, define KPIs, and influence our strategy.




Auctionet is a marketplace where auction houses from Sweden, the UK, Finland, Spain, Germany, and Denmark sell furniture, art, design items, collectibles, and more. We are now in search of a Data & Analytics lead at Auctionet.




About the Data & Analytics Role at Auctionet

You will play a critical role in defining and building Auctionet’s approach to data, analytics, and business intelligence from the ground up. As the key driver of our data strategy, you’ll work closely with teams across the company to inform decision-making, identify opportunities, and uncover actionable insights that accelerate our marketplace business in Sweden and throughout Europe.




Our data stack

Our current (ever evolving) data stack that was built up during the last year includes




Postgres as database
dbt for transformation
Sling and dlt for ingestion
Dagster for orchestration
Metabase for BI




Everything self-hosted in our Kubernetes based private cloud, maintained by our excellent DevOps team. Meaning we get a lot of the ease of cloud, without the cost monitoring.




Key Responsibilities: Data Strategy, Leadership, Business Intelligence

Develop and execute Auctionet’s comprehensive data and analytics strategy in line with company objectives.
Partner with executive leadership, product, technology, marketing, and operations teams to embed a data-driven culture that supports Auctionet’s ambitious growth plans.
Build and lead a best-in-class data & analytics team, fostering continuous learning and innovation.
Drive design and implementation of scalable, trusted, and secure data architecture and business intelligence platforms.
Establish frameworks and KPI dashboards to measure business performance and deliver regular insights to all key stakeholders.
Enable proactive, predictive analytics and data modelling to identify trends and inform future decision-making.
Advise on data integration and automation to streamline workflows and enhance efficiency across Auctionet’s marketplace.
Champion a culture of experimentation, curiosity, and knowledge sharing across the organisation.




About You: Data Leadership, Analytical Excellence, Visionary Thinking

Proven experience leading data and analytics teams in high-growth, digital or marketplace environments.
Strong knowledge of data architecture, cloud data platforms, business intelligence tools, and analytics methodologies.
Skilled at translating business needs into actionable data solutions, with a pragmatic and commercial approach.
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and storytelling skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.
Demonstrated ability to foster cross-functional collaboration and drive cultural change towards data-driven thinking.
Strong project management skills and a passion for innovation and continuous improvement.
Experience in the auction, e-commerce, or classified marketplace sector is a plus, but not required.
Full professional proficiency in English is required; knowledge of Swedish or other European languages is a bonus.




Our Recruitment Process

We have a straightforward process without unpleasant surprises. We'll start of with a short interview and greet just to get a feeling if we could be right for each other or not. We then have a few meetings (usually two or three) where we talk about you, the role and Auctionet - and you get the chance to talk to the people you will work closely with.




In the process, we will also ask you to do a small take-home exercise. And in the end, we hope it feels like the perfect fit for both of us!




Application Details

We will be reviewing applications continuously, but please submit your application no later than 2025-05-30.




Please note this role needs to be based in Stockholm, we will only consider current residents in Sweden. Although the role is in Stockholm, we do offer Hybrid work, ie you can work from home if you prefer, for part of your time.




About the Team

Currently the Data Team consist of only one person, which this role will be replacing. As a new department in Auctionet, established less than a year ago, we see great potential for this role and function within the company, and expect it to grow over time. The data team is part of the Technology department at Auctionet, which consists of 24 people, and works closely with developers and devops to design, develop and maintain the data stack.




Auctionet has around 170 employees and is the parent company of a wider group with approximately 400 colleagues across multiple countries.




Who We Are

Auctionet was founded in 2011 by a team of people with unique experience of online auctions. Read more about Auctionet here. In 2021 Auctionet acquired the auction house Stockholms Auktionsverk, and we are now by far the largest auction marketplace in the Nordics, and one of the larger auction marketplaces in the world. With this acquisition, Auctionet owns and operates both the oldest auction house in the world (1674) and the second oldest (1681), which means we have been working with sustainability for 350(!) years.




Join us in our vision to make valued objects accessible for everyone, from everywhere!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Our department plays an important role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver top analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed business goals.

You will be a part of a Squad consisting of Data Engineers and a Service Delivery Manager working towards the People and Culture business area. You will be part of a like-minded team that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create data solutions that bring value to our customers. You will also be involved and contribute to the Centers of Excellence (CoEs) in the organization. We work closely with the business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.

We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high-quality BI solutions. You will develop new data products and work with our existing portfolio as well as documentation and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in the cloud and on-premises. The cloud setup is in AWS with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool, and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on-premises platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle-based with Oracle 19C and Oracle Data Integrator. We are in a transition phase to move away from on-premises into our highly capable cloud platform.

Who You Are



4+ years of experience with DW development and support
2+ years of experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS/Snowflake
Deep knowledge of dimensional modeling, data access, and data storage
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Working experience with both low-code and high-code environments for ETL
Knowledge of PowerBI in Cloud, Tabular Editor, and other BI/DW tools is meriting
Basic understanding of git branching, and the ability to push and pull code to and from a git repository
Strong English language skills
Good knowledge of requirements collection for reporting applications



These skills are a bonus but not a must:



Experience in people and culture domains, procurement, or finance
Experience and enjoyment of agile methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
An academic degree in computer science or equivalent



We hope that you are someone that adds energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team’s development and are happy to drive improvements within both processes and tools. You are a team player who dares to take initiative and easily adapts to different situations and work conditions. You communicate fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, understanding requirements and analyzing data. You meet users’ expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. Additionally, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-04 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

We look forward to your application!

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-04 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

We look forward to your application!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.




With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.




The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.




This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.




As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.




What You'll Do:




Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.




Skills We're Looking For:




Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.




Why Join Us:




Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).







Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.

Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify’s Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify’s foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify’s platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify’s platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify’s platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify’s platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company’s long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Data Analyst med Arkitektfokus
Description:
Tycker du också att åsikter kräver insikter? Att viktiga affärsbeslut ska tas med analys och data som underlag? Är du en analytisk problemlösare som är van att arbeta med och visualisera stora datamängder? Kom och joina oss som Data Analyst på ICA Sverige!

Det här är ditt blivande jobb

Teamet du kommer jobba i består av ca 30 fantastiska kollegor och tillhör vår Data & Analytics funktion i Solna, men du kommer också arbeta i ett leveransteam med mixade data & analytics roller där man tillsammans stöttar ett av ICAs sponsorsområden.

Du som Data Analyst med arkitektfokus utgör en kritisk faktor när vi nu tar ICAs datadrivna arbete till nya nivåer och tvärs hela bolaget. I den här tjänsten kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och utvecklas inom analytiska metoder tillsammans med skickliga, likasinnade kollegor.

I denna roll kommer du att fungera som en viktig länk mellan våra dataanalytiker och arkitekter. Du kommer att arbeta både hands-on som dataanalytiker i ett av våra produktteam och samtidigt arbeta som arkitekt med fokus på vårt analyslager. Du kommer att leda initiativ som främjar gemensamma arbetssätt inom dataanalytikergruppen, förbättrad prestanda och tekniska vägval vid nya use case.

Vem är du?

Vi söker just nu en Data Analyst som har flera års erfarenhet i en liknande roll och som har jobbat med modellering och arkitektfrågor. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av och är trygg med att utveckla i SQL och är van att arbeta med stora datamängder och kombinerar data från olika källor. Vi jobbar med Tableau så vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av den, eller en liknande BI visualiseringsverktyg och någon molnlösning. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av GCP, Looker, DBT, GitHub, BigQuery och Python.

För att trivas på ICA ser vi att du är en affärsmässig och ansvarstagande person som har en god förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och inta ett helikopterperspektiv. Du har lätt för att inspirera och coacha andra i det du brinner för - data data data! För dig är ingen fråga för stor eller för liten och du räds inte att själv söka svar på frågor i de djupaste av datalager.

För att vara aktuell för denna roll måste du tala svenska och engelska obehindrat.

Kontaktinformation

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Magnus Gidlund på 072 220 02 93, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Bojana Mijocevic tel 076-695 15 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 2025-06-01.

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more
HTML:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Swedish.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.



Apply Online Today!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst till vårt specialistnätverk!




Är du en BI-Analytiker som omvandlar data till strategiska insikter? Vi bygger nu ett nätverk för spännande uppdrag hos ledande företag i Sverige.




I dagens datadrivna affärsvärld är förmågan att effektivt samla in, analysera och presentera data avgörande för framgång. Företag inom olika branscher söker efter kvalificerade Business Intelligence Analysts, som kan hjälpa dem att förstå sin verksamhet bättre, identifiera trender, optimera processer och fatta välgrundade beslut.




Ditt fokus:

🔹 Driva ETL-processer & säkerställa datakvalitet.

🔹 Generera affärskritiska insikter via avancerad dataanalys.

🔹 Skapa & förvalta dashboards/rapporter (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik etc.).

🔹 Omvandla data till handlingsbara rekommendationer.




Vi söker dig med:

Gedigen BI-erfarenhet, stark SQL-kompetens, vana vid BI-verktyg (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik m.fl.) samt god affärs- och kommunikationsförmåga. Du är analytisk, självgående och lösningsorienterad. Akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik, ekonomi eller ingenjörsvetenskap.




Läs mer på www.interimmarketing.se




Bli en del av vårt nätverk – för din framtida karriär:

Genom att registrera ditt intresse hos oss får du möjlighet att bli matchad mot spännande uppdrag och permanenta positioner som överensstämmer med din profil och dina ambitioner när rätt tillfälle uppstår.




Är du redo att ta nästa steg?

Anslut dig till vårt specialistnätverk genom att skicka in ditt CV och gärna ett personligt brev via den gröna knappen "Ansök" i slutet av annonsen på vår hemsida www.interimmarketing.se. Du landar där när du klickar på "Ansök". Du kan också ansöka enkelt med hjälp av din LinkedIn-profil . Vi behandlar din information konfidentiellt och kontaktar dig när relevanta möjligheter dyker upp. Varmt Välkommen till vårt kandidatnätverk!




Om Interim Marketing Solutions RBS AB

Vi hjälper företag med kompetensförsörjning, både interim, rekrytering och omställning, av så väl chefer som specialister. Vi har själva både erfarenhet av eget arbete i linjebefattningar och som interimskonsult.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Vi söker en driven Data Quality Analyst till området Data Quality inom Wholesale Solutions med inriktning på Spårbarhet.

Vi söker dig som brinner för masterdatafrågor och som har dokumenterad erfarenhet från tidigare arbete inom Masterdata där du haft en senior roll. Vidare tror vi att du har förståelse och intresse för datakvalitet och betydelsen av data i flödeskedjan tvärs organisationer samt förstår samspelet mellan verksamheten och IT-stöd. Du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.

Som Data Quality Analyst är du driven och har lätt för att samarbeta och har förmågan att representera Data Quality i stora projekt som har påverkan på Masterdata inom ICA. Kompetens inom spårbarhetsområdet är önskvärt men inget krav.

Vi ser även att du använder självledarskapet i vardagen och är förändringsbenägen med ett fokus på att ständigt förbättra arbetssätt och processer.

Så här arbetar en Data Quaity Analyst

Förvalta, utveckla och säkerställa hög kvalitet i masterdataprocesser utifrån ett dataperspektiv samt de data assets som faller inom rollens ansvar.

I samarbete med verksamheten och Digital & Technology samla in och hantera krav för de tekniska och funktionella lösningar som återfinns inom ICAs masterdataprocesser.

Initiera förändringar och driva ständiga förbättringar av masterdatas dataprocesser och masterdatahantering.

Tillsammans med Data Quality Key User och Digital & Technology hantera avancerad felsökning och komplicerad utredning av incidenter gällande data assets, processer och verktyg.

Säkra att relevant dokumentation av dataprocess skapas och löpande underhålls, samt att kontinuerliga utbildningsåtgärder verkar för att tillgodose verksamhetens behov av kompetens inom masterdataområdet.

Tillföra hög masterdatakompetens i projekt och arbetsgrupper som kräver avancerad kompetens inom data och därmed säkra att förändrade eller nyutvecklade masterdataprocesser eller verktyg verkar för ”Best Practice” inom Masterdata Management.

Tillsammans med andra Masterdataexperter säkra effektivt utnyttjande av tillgängliga standarder och uppsatta policys för hantering av ICAs masterdata.

Via ett engagerat självledarskap och nyfikenhet verka för att rollens kompetens ligger i linje med ICAs aktuella behov på kort och lång sikt.

Vad händer nu?

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande, så du är välkommen att skicka in din ansökan omgående. Vi reserverar oss för att tillsättning av tjänsten kan ske innan sista dagen för ansökan går ut.

Anställning:

Tillsvidare med tillträde snarast

Placeringsort:

Solna/Göteborg/Helsingborg

Kontaktperson:

Kajsa Fägerblad Area Manager Data Quality, ICA Sverige AB, tfn: +46722202154

Sista dag för ansökan:

2025-05-25

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.
Show more

Title: Sustainability Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Sustainability Analyst you will report to our Head of Sustainability and collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the development and implementation of our global sustainability strategy and communication, work proactively to ensure sustainability performance and compliance with environmental regulations and industry standards, and contribute to building the Voi brand sustainability content. This will include:




Sustainability strategy: Collaborate closely with the Head of Sustainability and other colleagues to define and implement Voi’s sustainability strategy, including optimising resource use to reduce environmental impact, and drive progress to position Voi as a global leader in sustainability.
Monitoring & supporting change: Work continuously to stay up to date on sustainability related regulations, industry peer activity, academic research, assess risk associated with the sustainability goals, and initiate and support change initiatives to achieve key sustainability goals.
Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g. carbon emissions, energy consumption and waste management, ensuring transparency, traceability, accountability and compliance with regulations, e.g. CSRD, CBAM and the EU taxonomy.
Analysis & reporting: Analyse data and develop recommendations for sustainability management and sustainability performance reports.
Communication: Support the sustainability-, tender-, investor relations- and marketing teams in crafting and delivering the Voi sustainability narrative based on the strategic sustainability direction and progress.




WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK

We’re looking for an analytical, thorough and solution oriented sustainability professional, with the ability to manage and sanity check large data sets, and collaborate efficiently with diverse stakeholders. Apart from being fluent in English, self-sufficient and goal-oriented, we believe the right person has:




B.Sc. in Engineering or Business, preferably with a sustainability specialisation
Experience from management consulting, sustainability consulting or a similar position in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Experience from managing data collection, data analysis and projects with multiple stakeholders
Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, experience using SQL and python is a merit
Experience of sustainability-, CSR or ESG controlling/reporting, industry standards (e.g. GRI, CSRD) and environmental management system (e.g.ISO 14001) is a merit
Experience with sustainable procurement and audits of external suppliers is a merit




WHY VOI?

Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:




Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution




Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.




Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.

Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.

Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.

Be a productive member of the team.




Requirements


5+ years as a Data Engineer

Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze business needs and deliver effective, scalable data solutions

Implement data governance and quality standards to maintain data accuracy and integrity

Manage and optimize data platforms, databases, and data warehouses to support advanced analytics initiatives

Diagnose and resolve issues in real-time and batch data pipelines, ensuring seamless data integration across systems

Proficient in PySpark and Apache Airflow

Working knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Advanced expertise in Oracle and PL/SQL

Proficient in Unix environments

Familiar with GitHub Actions and JFrog for automated deployment




Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.

Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.


What we offer?


Great compensation package and bonus plan.
Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.


Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
  • Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
  • Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
  • Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
  • Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
  • Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
  • Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
  • Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
  • Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
  • Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
  • Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
  • 4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
  • Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
  • Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
  • In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
  • Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
  • Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.

What we offer?

  • Great compensation package and bonus plan.
  • Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
  • Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
  • Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.

Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

This role can be baised either in Copenhagen or London (Shoreditch).

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
  • Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.
