Title: Junior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen - Hovedstaden - Denmark

Are you looking for a student job in data analytics and do you have an interest for the real estate market? Then this is a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!

What will you be doing?


The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be to support the team in leveraging our product portfolio and developing new data driven solutions to address new business challenges of our clients. The role will establish a profound relationship with the regional and EMEA research teams.

Your Key Responsibilities



Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams


Who are you?


We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications


Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):


You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish


About Us


CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer



A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
A good work and student environment
Attractive employee benefits


Next Step


We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.

Service line: Advisory Segment

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence, Internship, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company that operates within specialized areas like aerospace, defence, security, and space? Our Business Intelligence Team within the Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of our internal talent pipeline.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

We are currently facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes. We are looking for a highly motivated BI Intern to become part of this journey and to join our Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department in Lystrup, which has a variety of responsibilities.

We offer an exciting position where you can start building your dream career. We will focus on your professional and personal development, and you will have the opportunity to make your mark in a dynamic company. You will experience a variety of tasks and the opportunity to apply your theoretical skills in practice. We pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where we support each other to stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

As a BI Intern at Terma, you will be part of a company with many engaged and knowledgeable employees, where technology, innovation, strategy, and continuous improvements drive everything we do. You will work closely with skilled colleagues and on exciting projects.

How you will make a meaningful contribution

Your Key Responsibilities Include


Assist in the development and maintenance of BI reports and dashboards
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in our BI solutions
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our BI processes
Participate in data analysis and visualization projects
Support the team in ad-hoc data requests and troubleshooting


Bring your world class expertise into play

You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


We are looking for an Intern studying at the Bachelor’s or Master’s level within Business Intelligence, Data Science, Finance, or a similar field of study
Familiarity with BI tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, or DAX is a plus


As a person, you bring a positive, can-do attitude and you thrive on turning theory into action. You are self-driven, detail-oriented, and not afraid to juggle multiple tasks at once. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you take pride in delivering high-quality work on time.

The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, have an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, and show initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen, and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: osp@terma.com

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear in mind that both candidates and the candidate’s adult household members, for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails among other issues:


Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




🔎 About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




🎉 Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Show more

💚 Our recruitment process

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner (North)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste

Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 10%. That’s how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis, and yet we continue to waste edible food all over the world.

As the world’s largest food waste-fighting app, we connect stores that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who buy and enjoy it. But we’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation and our mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

This role is based in Amsterdam OR Copenhagen.

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will be embedded in the Operational Leadership team for our Cluster North European markets. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to our Vice President of Operations in driving key strategic decisions with a data-driven approach, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing data literacy across your operational area. You will be 1 of 6 in a similar role, each dedicated to an Operational Leadership team, working together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Cluster North European Operations leadership team decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive operational excellence in our Cluster North European markets
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions in our Cluster North European markets, with the support of your Vice President of Operations
Proactively bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Analytics team (embedded in other areas of the organisation) to the Cluster North European Operations leadership team;
Elevate the data literacy across the Cluster North European Operational leadership team
Identify, advocate, and build opportunities for scale and automation across the team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You demonstrate business acumen through significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations, Leadership; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are focused on business outcomes by framing insights in a way that inspires action
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corp) where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Working alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
Personal and professional development opportunities in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialize with colleagues that care to offer


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Do you want to become a Data Engineering Consultant?
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description


Would you like to turn data into useful knowledge? And would you like to work directly with clients while keeping up to date with new technologies? Then read on and become our future colleague as a data engineer consultant at Devoteam Data Driven 🚀

🕟 Full-time, permanent contract

📍 Central Copenhagen, near Vesterport Station

You will be part of a team of 60 experts who help companies get more insights out of their data using a wide palette of data tools. Below are a few examples where we have:


Migrated Novo Nordisk's global supply chain analytics solution from Alteryx-based workflows to a governed, cloud-native architecture using DBT, Snowflake, and Azure DevOps to support enterprise-scale analytics and collaboration.


Developed a comprehensive end-to-end data warehouse solution, featuring automated pipelines that structured dimensional data from diverse operational systems for unified analytics.


Assessed the current data landscape in Novonesis and implemented a new self-service landscape to enable the business users to utilise the power of the modern data stack


Helped Novo Nordisk become more data-driven by building data solutions in Production, Finance, Sales, R&D, HR, ESG, and many other departments




Long story short, we help our customers become more data-driven, enabling them to free up time, make better decisions, and discover new opportunities for growth.

Work assignments

As our next Data Engineer consultant, you’ll play a key role in advising clients, developing new data solutions, and contributing to new and exciting data initiatives. More specifically, the role as a data engineer consultant involves: 


Implementing and developing modern data platforms using DevOps & CI/CD practices


Designing & building data pipelines


Data modelling & orchestration 


Collaborating with the client’s data engineers, data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to solve business issues to ensure lasting value




You will work in a modern tool & technology stack, including: Snowflake, Databricks, Fabric, dbt, SQL, Python & many others. We strive to put the business issue first and tailor the best solution accordingly.

What you bring to the team

We're looking for talented individuals who can translate data challenges into actionable solutions and build strong client relationships. Ideally:


You have worked as a Data Engineer for 2-3 years


You are eager to work as a consultant, collaborating directly with our clients on different projects and have excellent communication skills


You are proficient in SQL & Python. Experience with Snowflake, Databricks, Fabric, Power Apps, DBT & cloud platforms is a plus


You have an analytical approach to problem-solving, with a strong interest in how to drive business improvement using data


You have completed a relevant Master’s degree


You live near Copenhagen




We are looking for new talented colleagues who can transform data into actionable insights and cultivate lasting relationships with new and existing customers. 

Why Devoteam Data Driven? 

You will join a fantastic team of talented, curious data experts. Beyond working with great colleagues on impactful projects, we offer comprehensive benefits to support your growth:

🧑‍🏫 Onboarding - A onboarding / graduate program to ensure you get the best possible start to your consulting career. Our latest onboarding team of 7 people will have 18 days of classroom training during their first months.

🚀 Career and development plans - we invest in our talent and ensure that you thrive and develop your skills

🌍 Knowledge communities - inspire and be inspired by other data experts

🧘Work-life balance - we strongly believe there should also be time for family, friends and hobbies outside of work! You will have 30 days of paid vacation yearly, but can take more time self-paid if you want to!

👯 Social events - many social events throughout the year with all sorts of fun activities outside of work. To plan this, we have a sports committee, culture committee and a party committee, which you are more than welcome to join!

Application process

Do you also want to advise our customers about data and help them become data-driven? Then send your CV today instead of tomorrow. 

We look forward to hearing from you!

About Devoteam

Devoteam is a leading digital consultancy. We are represented in 25 countries primarily in EMEA with +11.000 employees across the group. In Denmark we are around 300 people and work with customers in both the private and public sector.

The Danish team is spread across 3 business units that each work around digital transformation in different ways: Data Driven, ServiceNow & Management Consulting. This job description is for our Data Driven department that mainly does data analysis & data foundation projects and is located near Vesterport, Copenhagen.



Besides this we are strategic partners with: Microsoft, Google, AWS, Salesforce & ServiceNow.

Are you curious to learn more about Devoteam? If so, feel free to follow this link.

Show more
HTML:
Job Description
Would you like to turn data into useful knowledge? And would you like to work directly with clients while keeping up to date with new technologies? Then read on and become our future colleague as a data engineer consultant at Devoteam Data Driven 🚀

🕟 Full-time, permanent contract

📍 Central Copenhagen, near Vesterport Station

You will be part of a team of 60 experts who help companies get more insights out of their data using a wide palette of data tools. Below are a few examples where we have:

  • Migrated Novo Nordisk's global supply chain analytics solution from Alteryx-based workflows to a governed, cloud-native architecture using DBT, Snowflake, and Azure DevOps to support enterprise-scale analytics and collaboration.

  • Developed a comprehensive end-to-end data warehouse solution, featuring automated pipelines that structured dimensional data from diverse operational systems for unified analytics.

  • Assessed the current data landscape in Novonesis and implemented a new self-service landscape to enable the business users to utilise the power of the modern data stack

  • Helped Novo Nordisk become more data-driven by building data solutions in Production, Finance, Sales, R&D, HR, ESG, and many other departments



Long story short, we help our customers become more data-driven, enabling them to free up time, make better decisions, and discover new opportunities for growth.

Work assignments

As our next Data Engineer consultant, you’ll play a key role in advising clients, developing new data solutions, and contributing to new and exciting data initiatives. More specifically, the role as a data engineer consultant involves: 

  • Implementing and developing modern data platforms using DevOps & CI/CD practices

  • Designing & building data pipelines

  • Data modelling & orchestration 

  • Collaborating with the client’s data engineers, data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to solve business issues to ensure lasting value



You will work in a modern tool & technology stack, including: Snowflake, Databricks, Fabric, dbt, SQL, Python & many others. We strive to put the business issue first and tailor the best solution accordingly.

What you bring to the team

We're looking for talented individuals who can translate data challenges into actionable solutions and build strong client relationships. Ideally:

  • You have worked as a Data Engineer for 2-3 years

  • You are eager to work as a consultant, collaborating directly with our clients on different projects and have excellent communication skills

  • You are proficient in SQL & Python. Experience with Snowflake, Databricks, Fabric, Power Apps, DBT & cloud platforms is a plus

  • You have an analytical approach to problem-solving, with a strong interest in how to drive business improvement using data

  • You have completed a relevant Master’s degree

  • You live near Copenhagen



We are looking for new talented colleagues who can transform data into actionable insights and cultivate lasting relationships with new and existing customers. 

Why Devoteam Data Driven? 

You will join a fantastic team of talented, curious data experts. Beyond working with great colleagues on impactful projects, we offer comprehensive benefits to support your growth:

🧑‍🏫 Onboarding - A onboarding / graduate program to ensure you get the best possible start to your consulting career. Our latest onboarding team of 7 people will have 18 days of classroom training during their first months.

🚀 Career and development plans - we invest in our talent and ensure that you thrive and develop your skills

🌍 Knowledge communities - inspire and be inspired by other data experts

🧘Work-life balance - we strongly believe there should also be time for family, friends and hobbies outside of work! You will have 30 days of paid vacation yearly, but can take more time self-paid if you want to!

👯 Social events - many social events throughout the year with all sorts of fun activities outside of work. To plan this, we have a sports committee, culture committee and a party committee, which you are more than welcome to join!

Application process

Do you also want to advise our customers about data and help them become data-driven? Then send your CV today instead of tomorrow. 

We look forward to hearing from you!

About Devoteam

Devoteam is a leading digital consultancy. We are represented in 25 countries primarily in EMEA with +11.000 employees across the group. In Denmark we are around 300 people and work with customers in both the private and public sector.

The Danish team is spread across 3 business units that each work around digital transformation in different ways: Data Driven, ServiceNow & Management Consulting. This job description is for our Data Driven department that mainly does data analysis & data foundation projects and is located near Vesterport, Copenhagen.



Besides this we are strategic partners with: Microsoft, Google, AWS, Salesforce & ServiceNow.

Are you curious to learn more about Devoteam? If so, feel free to follow this link.

Title: Business Insights Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
JOB TITLE – Business Insights Manager, Next Generation Products

LOCATION – Copenhagen, Denmark

HOURS – Full Time

About The Role

We are excited to offer an incredible opportunity as Business Insights Manager for Scandinavian Tobacco Group’s growing Next Generation Products team. In this pivotal role, you will be essential in tracking and following up upon our strategic initiatives through commercial insights. To succeed, you must be able to build up a strong understanding of market dynamics and translate findings into commercial actions across functions within our organizational teams. You will be responsible for tracking our global footprint and identifying our synergetic thresholds - internally and externally.

Your role as a self-reliant professional is crucial in our fast-paced environment. A key part of your role will involve ensuring clear communication and alignment within the organization, while fostering robust professional relationships. You will be reporting to the Head of Commercial Insights.

WHAT WILL YOU BE RESPONSIBLE FOR?


Collecting Data & Tracking of strategic and commercial initiatives:
Collecting data and insights across functions and teams to conduct analysis and reporting on commercial initiatives within our product life cycle: from P&L, budgets and forecasting to product launches, marketing initiatives and activations, market performances, growth tendencies and portfolio adaptions.
Develop and implement comprehensive tracking tools for our global performances and organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects across markets are captured and distributed ongoingly.
Understand, develop and adapt strong methodological frameworks and reports to capture and consolidate our performances within organizational teams.
Lead and ensure a data driven approach to commercial initiatives, capturing enhancers of growth and profitability across markets.


Foster insights into strategic performance culture


Understand stakeholder capabilities, targets and ambitions and convert these into trackable KPIs.
Identify, evaluate and share insights ongoingly and ensure fostering of insights into tangible and trackable decisions across functions and teams.
Evaluate adaptability and scalability of local, regional and global know-how and winning formulars to build the NGP teams’ insights toolbox.
Assess global and local dynamics and convert proven concepts into trackable actions across organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects.


Follow Up And Global Collaboration


Follow up on commercial and strategic decisions across teams via KPIs and ensure distribution of commercial insights to stakeholders.
Work closely with regional and local teams to adapt insights to local market needs and ensure successful growth.
Drive a cohesive approach to data management and decisions across markets, driving synergies and efficiencies globally.
Enable repeatability of proven concepts across functions.
Contribute to and drive data driven performance culture across global teams.


Performance driven approach through data


Collection, analysis and tracking of data can’t stand alone in this role. You will be the enabler of translating and distributing insights into recommended actions to our global stakeholders across functions.
Our team will lead the exploration and validation of proven concepts through data and commercial insights.
We will conceptualize insights into tangible actions and trackable KPIs to ensure repeatability.
You will work closely with R&D, category, operational, marketing, and sales teams to ensure relevance and implementation of insights to reach the organization’s strategic targets and profitability.


WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WILL BE REQUIRED?


3-5 years of experience as business and/or data analysist, ideally within multinational FMCG companies.
In-depth experience with BI-tools, Powerquery and Excel is required. PowerPoint skills and proven experience in utilizing other data analytics tools is a great plus.
Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking with a track record of identifying and capitalizing on growth opportunities.
Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to build assumptions based on limited data.
Desire to shape the role in line with the dynamic environment and evolving needs
Deep understanding of consumer behaviour, what drives their decisions and how we can adjust our strategies to fit their needs and expectations.
Excellent project management skills, with experience leading cross-functional teams & influence senior stakeholders.
Strong communication and relationship-building abilities across diverse global teams.
Fluency in English and ability to travel 5-10% of time.


OUR HIRING PROCESS

Requirements

Before we enter a hiring process, your job application will be reviewed by a member of our recruiting team. Your application will be reviewed in line with the hiring competencies we have for the role you have applied for. If your experience aligns with the requirements, you will enter our hiring process which will consist of the following:


Recruiter Screen
Hiring Manager Interview
Behavioral Assessment
Final Task


WHAT IS ON OFFER?

At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we offer a competitive compensation package, including a generous pension scheme, healthcare, dental, and career development opportunities. We also provide you with the chance to be part of a dynamic, results oriented & global company that values continuous growth, sustainability with consumer at the heart of everything we do.

About Scandinavian Tobacco Group

Scandinavian Tobacco Group is a global leader in cigars and tobacco products, with a rich heritage dating back 250 years. Since our formation in 1961, we've grown into a truly international company, operating in over 100 countries with a diverse workforce of more than 10,000 employees representing numerous nationalities and cultures. Our success is built on a portfolio of iconic brands including Signature, Cohiba, Macanudo, CAO, and Partagas. We specialize in crafting cigars and tobacco products that are synonymous with moments that matter - celebrations, achievements, and life's special occasions. We're proud of our dynamic growth strategy, having successfully acquired and integrated multiple companies over the past decade. This approach has not only expanded our market presence but also enriched our organizational culture with diverse perspectives and expertise. Sustainability is at the heart of our operations. We're committed to minimizing our environmental footprint and implementing responsible practices across our supply chain. This dedication to sustainability extends to our relationships with employees, partners, and the communities where we operate. At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we foster an inclusive, international work environment where collaboration and knowledge-sharing are key. We believe that our diverse team is our greatest strength, driving innovation and helping us to continuously evolve in a changing global market. We're always looking for talented individuals who share our passion for excellence and our commitment to creating a positive impact. By joining our team, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to a company that values creativity, embraces change, and encourages you to craft a career that truly makes you more. Whether you're collaborating with colleagues across continents, contributing to our sustainability initiatives, or helping to integrate newly acquired businesses, you'll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that's shaping the future of our industry.

Please be informed that this Direct Search is conducted exclusively by Scandinavian Tobacco Group. We do not accept applications from agencies, and we will not provide compensation for unsolicited CVs.

Title: BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist BOLIA
Description:
At BOLIA, we are constantly evolving and have high ambitions for our IT solutions to create the best possible experiences for our customers, colleagues, and partners. We are heavily data-driven in our decision-making, and we have a growing need for outstanding BI reports and analyses across the entire business. This encompasses everything from store personnel to back-office functions, as well as BOLIA's management group.

About The Job

In short, we have a wealth of data at BOLIA, and we aim to utilize it even more effectively than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at BOLIA, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your tasks

The tasks in this role are numerous and varied. Examples include:


Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in PowerBI to enhance BOLIA's decision-making capabilities and foster a performance-driven culture.
Take ownership of BOLIA’s BI platform, with a primary focus on the front-end. This includes defining governance and best practice principles for BI in BOLIA.
Collaborate closely with your colleague responsible for backend BI tasks, who will establish the data foundation for your work, primarily by integrating it into our BI cube.
Participate in the ongoing project including taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabric, expanding our current reporting capabilities.
Provide second-level support for BI frontend-related tasks.
Manage vendors and follow up on deliveries from external partners who assist with BI work.
Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA.
Participate in the BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.


BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area, in collaboration with your colleagues. You will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues across all departments. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Qualifications

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.


You are highly skilled at developing precise and advanced PowerBI reports, consistently delivering insightful and impactful data visualizations, with 3+ years of documented experience.
You are passionate about inspiring others and showcasing the potential of data and Business Intelligence to drive better decision-making across the organization.
You possess strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
You have knowledge of DAX, Star Schema modeling, GIT, and the creation of custom visuals, which is considered an advantage.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
You have a high level of attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality in your work.
You have a collaborative approach, working effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals and drive organizational success.
You are eager to acquire new knowledge and stay updated on the latest trends in your field, such as AI and Microsoft Copilot for PowerBI.


BOLIA as a workplace


We are located in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
We have a very active staff association that regularly organizes a variety of events, from parties to knitting clubs.
We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.


Do you want to join our journey?

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend sending your CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact IT Business Performance Manager, Kasper Poulsen, at kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst – Power Markets




A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quant Analyst to strengthen its Quant trading team within the European Power market.




What We’re Looking For:

Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills
In-depth understanding of the European Power market
Strong Python programming skills (experience with SQL or other languages is a plus)
Proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams
A flexible mindset with a passion for tackling new challenges and solving complex problems
Demonstrated experience in writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and enhance quantitative models and analytical tools
Collaborate closely with various teams, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology




Your Background:

Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Finance, or a related field
At least 2 and a half years of experience in the Power sector




Collaboration:

You’ll work directly with teams across the business - Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT

Title: Data Analyst til Claims Analytics - barselsvikariat
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Gjensidige er et nordisk skadeforsikringsselskab, som er noteret på Oslo Børs. Vi har ca. 4.500 medarbejdere, heraf 1.100 i Danmark, og vi tilbyder skadeforsikring i Norge, Danmark og Sverige. I Norge tilbyder vi også pension og opsparing. Driftsindtægterne var 36 mia. NOK i 2023, mens forvaltningskapitalen udgjorde 148 mia. NOK.

Brænder du for analyse og data? Vil du bidrage til at gøre Gjensidige endnu mere indsigtsdrevet? Nu har du muligheden!

Gode grunde til at arbejde i Gjensidige

I Gjensidige har vi arbejdet for at sikre liv, sundhed og værdier i over 200 år. Vi har som ambition at være Nordens mest kundeorienterede skadeforsikringsselskab, og koncernens strategi er at være indsigt- og analysebaseret. Vi søger nu efter en engageret og dygtig Data Analytiker til et vikariat.

Division Skade skal levere markedets bedste kundeoplevelser, når skaden er sket. Vi har satset stort på ny teknologi og automatisering de sidste år, og har ambitiøse mål for fortsat effektivisering og teknologiudvikling. Teamet i Claims Analytics er helt centralt i dette arbejde. Afdelingen består af 7 dygtige medarbejdere, 4 i Norge og 3 i Danmark. Den ene data scientist i Danmark skal på barselsorlov i september 2025 og vi søger derfor en vikar for hende i denne periode. Vi arbejder sammen på tværs for at gøre Skade endnu mere analyse- og indsigtsdrevet, og udnytte nye muligheder. I rollen som Data Analyst kan du gøre en forskel i dette arbejde. Hos os vil du arbejde med spændende og udfordrende opgaver.

Din hverdag som Data Analyst i Claims Analytics vil blandt andet bestå af:


Bidrage til at opnå koncernens ambitiøse mål for at reducere erstatningsomkostninger, bæredygtige og effektive skadeprocesser samt markedets bedste kundeoplevelser drevet af AI, data og analytics
Udvikle gode styreværktøjer for skadeorganisationen
Overvåge, analysere og formidle indsigt knyttet til drift, erstatningsomkostninger og udvikling
Rapportering og prognoser



Vi forestiller os, at du har:


En relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau inden for f.eks. statistik, matematik, økonomi, IT eller lignende
Kendskab og erfaring med programmering og analyseværktøjer (for eksempel SAS/ SQL/ Python/ Power BI/ dbt /Databricks)
Det er en fordel hvis du har kendskab til forsikring, men det er ikke et krav
Omgængelig, trives med at formidle indsigt og kommunikerer godt på et skandinavisk sprog og engelsk (mundtligt og skriftligt)
Forretningsorienteret og relationsskabende både indenfor og udenfor teamet
Nysgerrig og kan lide at udforske potentialet i komplekse og store mængder data fra flere forskellige kilder
Gåpåmod og er vedholdende
Tager initiativ, kan lide et højt tempo, er selvmotiverende og samtidig en holdspiller



Hvad kan vi tilbyde

Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med en samling af drevne, fagligt dygtige og søde kollegaer i både Danmark og Norge.

Gjensidige er et af Nordens største forsikringsselskaber, så der er mange muligheder for både faglig og personlig udvikling – på tværs af fag og landegrænser.

Du får gode vilkår herunder fordelagtige forsikringer og pensionsordning og - hvis vi selv skal sige det - et hav af gode kollegaer. Derudover får du en arbejdsplads placeret i København SV, i moderne omgivelser med nem adgang til offentlig transport og gode parkeringsmuligheder.

Du vil blive omfattet af forsikringsoverenskomsten.

Barselsvikariatet er på 9 måneder og med ønsket opstart d. 1. august 2025.

Er du interesseret?

Så send os din ansøgning og CV snarest muligt, da vi indkalder til samtaler løbende.

Vi opfordrer alle kandidater, uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, seksualitet og handicap til at søge stillinger i Gjensidige, da vi er en virksomhed, der ønsker at afspejle det mangfoldige samfund vi er en del af.

Ansættelsesleder Kontakter: Ariane,

(+47)97193475, ariane.grumstad@gjensidige.no

Ansøgningsfrist: 29/05/2025
Show more
HTML:
Gjensidige er et nordisk skadeforsikringsselskab, som er noteret på Oslo Børs. Vi har ca. 4.500 medarbejdere, heraf 1.100 i Danmark, og vi tilbyder skadeforsikring i Norge, Danmark og Sverige. I Norge tilbyder vi også pension og opsparing. Driftsindtægterne var 36 mia. NOK i 2023, mens forvaltningskapitalen udgjorde 148 mia. NOK.

Brænder du for analyse og data? Vil du bidrage til at gøre Gjensidige endnu mere indsigtsdrevet? Nu har du muligheden!

Gode grunde til at arbejde i Gjensidige

I Gjensidige har vi arbejdet for at sikre liv, sundhed og værdier i over 200 år. Vi har som ambition at være Nordens mest kundeorienterede skadeforsikringsselskab, og koncernens strategi er at være indsigt- og analysebaseret. Vi søger nu efter en engageret og dygtig Data Analytiker til et vikariat.

Division Skade skal levere markedets bedste kundeoplevelser, når skaden er sket. Vi har satset stort på ny teknologi og automatisering de sidste år, og har ambitiøse mål for fortsat effektivisering og teknologiudvikling. Teamet i Claims Analytics er helt centralt i dette arbejde. Afdelingen består af 7 dygtige medarbejdere, 4 i Norge og 3 i Danmark. Den ene data scientist i Danmark skal på barselsorlov i september 2025 og vi søger derfor en vikar for hende i denne periode. Vi arbejder sammen på tværs for at gøre Skade endnu mere analyse- og indsigtsdrevet, og udnytte nye muligheder. I rollen som Data Analyst kan du gøre en forskel i dette arbejde. Hos os vil du arbejde med spændende og udfordrende opgaver.

Din hverdag som Data Analyst i Claims Analytics vil blandt andet bestå af:

  • Bidrage til at opnå koncernens ambitiøse mål for at reducere erstatningsomkostninger, bæredygtige og effektive skadeprocesser samt markedets bedste kundeoplevelser drevet af AI, data og analytics
  • Udvikle gode styreværktøjer for skadeorganisationen
  • Overvåge, analysere og formidle indsigt knyttet til drift, erstatningsomkostninger og udvikling
  • Rapportering og prognoser


Vi forestiller os, at du har:

  • En relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau inden for f.eks. statistik, matematik, økonomi, IT eller lignende
  • Kendskab og erfaring med programmering og analyseværktøjer (for eksempel SAS/ SQL/ Python/ Power BI/ dbt /Databricks)
  • Det er en fordel hvis du har kendskab til forsikring, men det er ikke et krav
  • Omgængelig, trives med at formidle indsigt og kommunikerer godt på et skandinavisk sprog og engelsk (mundtligt og skriftligt)
  • Forretningsorienteret og relationsskabende både indenfor og udenfor teamet
  • Nysgerrig og kan lide at udforske potentialet i komplekse og store mængder data fra flere forskellige kilder
  • Gåpåmod og er vedholdende
  • Tager initiativ, kan lide et højt tempo, er selvmotiverende og samtidig en holdspiller


Hvad kan vi tilbyde

Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med en samling af drevne, fagligt dygtige og søde kollegaer i både Danmark og Norge.

Gjensidige er et af Nordens største forsikringsselskaber, så der er mange muligheder for både faglig og personlig udvikling – på tværs af fag og landegrænser.

Du får gode vilkår herunder fordelagtige forsikringer og pensionsordning og - hvis vi selv skal sige det - et hav af gode kollegaer. Derudover får du en arbejdsplads placeret i København SV, i moderne omgivelser med nem adgang til offentlig transport og gode parkeringsmuligheder.

Du vil blive omfattet af forsikringsoverenskomsten.

Barselsvikariatet er på 9 måneder og med ønsket opstart d. 1. august 2025.

Er du interesseret?

Så send os din ansøgning og CV snarest muligt, da vi indkalder til samtaler løbende.

Vi opfordrer alle kandidater, uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, seksualitet og handicap til at søge stillinger i Gjensidige, da vi er en virksomhed, der ønsker at afspejle det mangfoldige samfund vi er en del af.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we're looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the "why" behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: BI udvikler
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du en passioneret data-entusiast med en evne til at forvandle komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede indsigter?




Hos NCG søger de en erfaren og engageret BI Developer til at styrke deres Data Analytics team. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at drive dere datadrevne beslutningsprocesser og hjælpe dem med at tage deres BI-løsninger til det næste niveau.




Mission

De står midt i en spændende digital transformation, hvor de bevæger sig mod en cloud-baseret eller hybrid infrastruktur. Du vil være med til at forme fremtiden og sikre, at ders data er grundlaget for vores succes.




Du bliver en del af et stærkt team, som har en god balance mellem drift og udvikling, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med både vedligehold og nye projekter.




Kerneopgaver

Din hverdag vil være fyldt med spændende udfordringer og varierede opgaver:

Du vil dykke ned i forretningens behov og omsætte dem til datadrevne løsninger i samarbejde med nøgleinteressenter.
Du vil være ansvarlig for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af dashboards og rapporter i Qlik Sense og Power BI.
Du vil udføre dybdegående analyser og identificere trends, mønstre og forretningskritiske indsigter, der kan drive beslutninger.
Du vil bidrage til udviklingen af KPI'er og datamodeller, der gør data let tilgængelige og anvendelige i hele organisationen.
Du vil spille en aktiv rolle i overgangen til en moderne cloud-baseret platform (Microsoft Azure/Fabric og Power BI).
Du vil supportere forretningen med træning og løbende forbedringer af BI-løsninger.
Du vil deltage i spændende projekter, hvor data er i centrum.




Kvalifikationer

Vi leder efter dig, der:

Har solid erfaring med udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger i Power BI og SQL.
Er dygtig til dataanalyse og fortolkning af komplekse datasæt.
Besidder stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner.
Har en god forståelse for forretningsprocesser.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og tage ansvar for dine opgaver.
Har erfaring med Qlik Sense og Azure/Fabric (eller er motiveret for at lære det).




Om Nic. Christiansen Gruppen

Nic. Christiansen Gruppen er en af Danmarks største bilkoncerner, der siden grundlæggelsen i 1967 har arbejdet med bilimport og -detailsalg samt finansiering og leasing af biler.




Den familieejede koncern har hovedsæde i Kolding og står i dag for den danske import af Hyundai, BYD, Omoda & Jaecoo, Ford, Land Rover og Jaguar. Herudover ejer koncernen de seks bilkæder Bayern AutoGroup, May & Olde, Stadac, Terminalen, ERA BILER og British MotorGroup samt værkstedskæden Skorstensgaard og leasing- og finansieringsselskabet NCG Finans.




Interesseret?

Så søg stillingen ved at klikke “ansøg”. Vi er på udkig efter medarbejdere, som kan starte snarest muligt, så tøv ikke med at sende os din ansøgning og dit CV. Har du nogen spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte konsulent Julius Hauge på mail julius.hauge@randstad.dk.




Denne proces håndteres af Randstad, og alle henvendelser bedes rettet hertil.




Om Randstad

Randstad er verdens største HR-udbyder og ‘partner for talent’. Vi giver lige muligheder til alle uanset baggrund og hjælper kandidater med at forblive relevante på et hastigt skiftende arbejdsmarked. Vi tror på et inkluderende arbejdsmarked, hvor alle kan være sig selv og føle sig velkomne.




Vores markedsindsigt og store kendskab til arbejdsmarkedet hjælper virksomheder med at opbygge en kvalificeret, mangfoldig og fleksibel arbejdsstyrke, og vi støtter mennesker og virksomheder i at nå deres fulde potentiale. Det er det, vi er her for, og det er det, der motiverer os hver dag.




Randstad DK er en del af den internationale Randstad Group. Vi formidler dagligt arbejde til over 600.000 mennesker verden over og er førende inden for rekruttering, karriererådgivning og fleksibel arbejdskraft i Danmark, med afdelinger i København, Aarhus, Aalborg og Kolding.

Title: Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics
Description:
Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics




About the Job

JOE & THE JUICE is entering a new phase of data-driven, scalable global growth. We are now looking for a sharp, strategic, and tech-savvy Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics to join our high-performing Growth team at our Global HQ in Copenhagen, supporting the growth journey of opening and operating +1,000 stores within the coming years.




Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard, you will play a central role in enabling decision-making, developing forecasting models, and driving AI integration across the business. This is a hands-on and highly visible position, giving you exposure to C-Level stakeholders and the opportunity to shape the analytical and strategic engine behind our international expansion.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain business-critical dashboards and forecasting models to support global expansion.
Establish performance and forecasting frameworks using tools like Snowflake and Power BI.
Automate reporting pipelines and deliver structured insights for leadership and Growth Committee reviews.
Act as the AI lead for the Growth team - identifying high-impact use cases and supporting implementation.
Translate strategic goals into measurable KPIs and ensure alignment with commercial objectives.
Champion data governance and help build the internal analytics infrastructure.
Provide decision support for real estate, budget planning, and cross-functional growth initiatives.
Collaborate with Real Estate, Finance, Legal, and Operations teams to drive performance and prioritization.
Guide junior analysts and contribute to building a high-performance team culture within Growth.




Key Qualifications

You have a Master’s degree in finance, business administration, or related fields
You have 4+ years of experience in analytics, consulting, strategy, or finance.
You’re highly proficient in Power BI, AI, Excel, and PowerPoint.
You have experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data platforms.
You can communicate complex insights clearly to both technical and commercial stakeholders.
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working cross-functionally.
You are commercially sharp, curious, and energized by building new systems and tools.




The Benefits

We offer a benefits package that includes a paid pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-ified benefits:

Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 160+ employees.
Our office facilities include a fully staffed JOE & THE JUICE bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice, and barista coffee.
Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
In Joe, we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings, and Friday bars.
Fitness facilities filled with all the equipment you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible showers with complimentary towels and a steam room.




The Process

We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible.

We will only consider applications through Easy Apply and will conduct interviews on a rolling basis.




If you have any questions, please direct them to our Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard. Please note that we cannot guarantee a response to personal requests or messages.




Read how we handle your data during the recruitment process here: https://www.joejuice.com/policy/recruitment-privacy-notice

  • You are commercially sharp, curious, and energized by building new systems and tools.


The Benefits

We offer a benefits package that includes a paid pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-ified benefits:

  • Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 160+ employees.
  • Our office facilities include a fully staffed JOE & THE JUICE bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice, and barista coffee.
  • Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
  • In Joe, we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
  • Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings, and Friday bars.
  • Fitness facilities filled with all the equipment you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible showers with complimentary towels and a steam room.


The Process

We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible.

We will only consider applications through Easy Apply and will conduct interviews on a rolling basis.


If you have any questions, please direct them to our Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard. Please note that we cannot guarantee a response to personal requests or messages.


Read how we handle your data during the recruitment process here: https://www.joejuice.com/policy/recruitment-privacy-notice

Title: Principal Statistician
Description:
Principal Statistician | Global CRO |Denmark| Home Based |

Award-winning global biometric CRO have multiple opportunities for experienced Principal Statisticians to join its growing team.

Partnering with top pharma, biotech, and medical device companies, they deliver high-quality biostatistics, programming, data management, and data science services. Principal Statisticians can either be a hands-on technical role or more focused on being a Lead Statistician and is a great opportunity to grow with a recognized CRO, gain pharma experience, and benefit from continuous learning and development.

What you will be doing:

You will be working as a statistician on clinical trials; producing and validating complex outputs to excellent quality whilst adhering to deliverable timelines.

being responsible for statistical aspects of reporting out study results. Working as a lead statistician across multiple studies, with the opportunity to oversee more junior leads and supporting regulatory interaction Cardiology experience is a plus.

What you will need:

Educated to PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, statistics or a related discipline
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry to have a good awareness of clinical trial issues, design, and implementation.
Familiarity with GCP and regulatory requirements
Experience of writing SAPs, protocols

What’s in it for you:

Recognized as an outstanding workplace, committed to employee engagement, satisfaction, and work-life balance.
Structured training, development plans, and a supportive, friendly environment.
Condensed hours for a shorter workweek.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fully remote role available in Denmark.

What to do next:

If this opportunity is of interest, please apply now with your CV as the organisation are looking to welcome Principal Statisticians onboard as soon as possible.

Not what you’re looking for?

Please contact Mark O'Brien at mark@warmanobrien.com for a confidential discussion about potential other opportunities in Denmark and across Europe.

Title: Senior/principal Power BI-konsulent søges til ambitiøst Business Analytics-team!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for alt, der rimer på Power BI – og kan du hjælpe virksomheder med at få mere værdi ud af deres løsninger gennem governance? Har du mindst 5 års erfaring som konsulent, og er du klar til at tage næste skridt i din karriere? Så er du måske vores nye senior/principal Power BI-konsulent på kontoret i København!




Hos dataon er vores fokus helt skarpt og vi arbejder udelukkende med data/BI projekter omkring Microsofts platform! Vores kunder er i forskellige brancher og der er rig mulighed for at blive udfordret og lære nyt. Din indsats gør en mærkbar forskel og du får mulighed for være med til at udvikle nye forretningsideer og nye områder. dataon har en flad organisationsstruktur hvor der er kort vej til de tre ejere, som er en aktiv del af virksomheden.




I Business Analytics-teamet brænder vi for alt, der rimer på Power BI. Kompetenceniveauet og kreativiteten er høj. Vi sparrer, deler viden og hjælper hinanden i mål. Vi arbejder både selvstændigt og i fællesskab – her er der højt til loftet, plads til grin og et stærkt fokus på faglig udvikling. Vores tone er uformel, og hverdagen byder på masser af variation – ingen dage er ens.




En af medarbejderne i teamet fortæller: "Hos dataon er der plads til faglig udvikling, spændende projekter og masser af hjælp fra dygtige kolleger – alt sammen i en social kultur med inspirerende ledere". 

- kunne det være noget for dig?




Om rollen

Som en del af vores Business Analytics-team kommer du til at:

Rådgive kunder om datadrevne beslutninger og Power BI-løsninger
Udvikle rapporter, semantiske modeller og Power Query-løsninger
Hjælpe kunder med at få mere værdi ud af Power BI ved hjælp af dataons Governance-model
Uddanne brugere og sikre værdiskabende implementeringer
Deltage i initiativer som pre-sale, events og marketing – vi er en mindre virksomhed, og du får mulighed for at sætte dit præg
Bidrage med små indlæg og artikler, hvis du har lyst




Hvem er du?

Vi leder efter dig, der:

Har mindst 5 års erfaring som konsulent med Power BI og datamodellering
Brænder for Power BI og følger med i de nyeste features og muligheder
Kan omsætte forretningskrav til konkrete og brugbare løsninger
Kan tage ansvar for leverancer og sikre høj kvalitet
Er proaktiv, ansvarlig, team orienteret – og motiveres af at gøre en forskel




Hvad vi tilbyder

 Hos dataon bliver du en del af et dedikeret team med høj faglighed, fleksibilitet og fokus på udvikling. Vi har:

En dynamisk organisation med korte beslutningsveje.
Ca. 40 engagerede kollegaer, der stræber efter banebrydende løsninger.
Et arbejdsmiljø, hvor teamspirit og innovation går hånd i hånd.
Show more
