  • Et arbejdsmiljø, hvor teamspirit og innovation går hånd i hånd.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: CRM Analyst
Place: Farum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Change Lingerie is looking for a motivated and detail-oriented CRM Analyst to manage and optimize customer relationships through our Customer Data Platform. In this role, you'll be a key driver of our day-to-day CRM activities, develop customer segmentation strategies, and provide insights to improve customer engagement, loyalty, and sales across all channels. You will be a self-starter ready to drive multiple projects enhancing our current CRM system and customer experiences.

This position combines CRM system management with customer data analysis, offering you the opportunity to work closely with our wider marketing functions to help deliver personalized, data-driven experiences that enhance our customers’ satisfaction and retention. This position reports into the Senior Customer Insights Manager.

Key Responsibilities

CRM Management:


Assist with the day-to-day operations of our CRM platform, Bloomreach, including user setup, permissions, and troubleshooting.
Help configure and optimize customer journeys, workflows, and triggered communications to improve customer engagement.
Support the integration of CRM with other marketing and e-commerce tools to ensure smooth data flow.


Customer Segmentation & Targeting:


Drive development of customer segments based on purchase history, engagement patterns, and demographics.
Support the marketing team by providing targeted customer audiences for campaigns, loyalty programs, and retention efforts.


Analytics & Reporting:


Monitor CRM KPIs such as engagement rates, purchase frequency, consent and Customer Lifetime Value (CLV).
Assist with the creation of reports and dashboards to track customer behavior and campaign performance.
Provide data insights to support strategies for improving personalization, retention, and conversion rates.


Cross-Team Collaboration:


Work closely with the Marketing, E-commerce, and Web development teams to ensure CRM strategies align with broader business goals.
Support the marketing team by providing data insights that help refine marketing campaigns and customer targeting.


Data Management & Quality Control:


Maintain accurate, clean, and well-organized customer data within Bloomreach.
Implement data hygiene practices to keep our customer database clean and accurate.
Perform regular audits to ensure data consistency and relevance for CRM campaigns.


Key Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in CRM coordination or management, customer data analysis, or related fields (internships or relevant projects are a plus).
Experience with Bloomreach or similar CRM platforms.
Understanding of customer segmentation, lifecycle marketing, and data management best practices.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to create reports or dashboards.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI or similar).
Attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and strong communication skills.
Experience or interest in the fashion, beauty, lingerie, or retail industry is a plus.


What We Offer


A great opportunity to continue your career in CRM and data analysis with an international retail brand with a strong focus on driving value in CRM.
A supportive and collaborative work environment where you’ll learn and grow professionally.
Exposure to cutting-edge CRM and personalization technologies like Bloomreach.
Competitive salary, pension plan and health insurance
Great daily lunch


We are looking forward to receiving your application

We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously. Please use our recruitment system and the "Apply for position"-button. Applications sent via email will not be handled.

Title: Lead Business Intelligence Specialist, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
CIP Fund Solutions - a platform delivery company working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

CIP Fund Solutions provides scalable and integrated business services, complex fund management and investments solutions with the aim of advancing CIP’s investment products and channels – and supporting the continuous value creation across the CIP platform.

The role
As our new Lead BI Specialist in our Data & Analytics team, you’ll join a team of ambitious professionals. The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering scalable digital solutions and advisory to the business with the intention of enabling growth across the CIP platforms. The team is comprised of a set of specialists focusing on master data management, data engineering, and business intelligence.

You will be the technical lead on Power BI, in a growing BI team. In this role, you will ensure the team adheres to best practices and delivers high-quality BI solutions.

You will be responsible for the Power BI platform, ensuring that usage of the platform follows best practices as a subject matter expert. You will manage larger BI projects, develop new dashboards, as well as maintain existing dashboards as needed. Additionally, you will work closely with other departments to ensure BI solutions align with business goals and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.

You will also be expected to stay updated with the latest features of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, continuously improving the BI solutions to meet the evolving needs of the business.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Creation of new and maintenance of existing BI solutions such as dashboards and semantic data models
Refinement and estimation of new BI projects and solutions in collaboration with stakeholders
Management of consultants for externally staffed BI projects, ensuring alignment with internal standards and practices
Ensuring that the future BI setup is maintainable and scalable by implementing best practices in data architecture and governance
Staying updated on new features being released for Fabric and Power BI, and evaluating their potential impact on current and future projects
Design and implement self-service guidelines and governance with the aim of enabling citizen developers
Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices
Maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new BI products, contributing to a cohesive user experience
Design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making


You
We are looking for candidates who have completed their master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position, using Power BI and preferably Microsoft Fabric.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

We look for the following in a candidate

Self-igniting and customer-centric: You have a proactive attitude and a keen focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy: You are meticulous and ensure precision in your work.
Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills: You possess strong analytical abilities and can effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills: You can communicate clearly and effectively with various stakeholders.
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment: You thrive in a dynamic and diverse setting, collaborating with teams across different regions.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more

  • Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices

  • Design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making

You
We are looking for candidates who have completed their master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position, using Power BI and preferably Microsoft Fabric.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

We look for the following in a candidate
  • Self-igniting and customer-centric: You have a proactive attitude and a keen focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.
  • Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy: You are meticulous and ensure precision in your work.
  • Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills: You possess strong analytical abilities and can effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
  • Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills: You can communicate clearly and effectively with various stakeholders.
  • Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment: You thrive in a dynamic and diverse setting, collaborating with teams across different regions.

The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.

---

Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Senior Martech & Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

We’re looking for an exceptional Martech and Data Specialist to join the growing Data and Analytics Team at Too Good To Go.

Your mission

We are looking for a technically skilled and data-driven individual to enhance our digital marketing analytics capabilities. This role is critical in optimizing our tools, processes, and data infrastructure, enabling actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making. You will play a key role in helping to advance attribution models, improving data quality, and supporting marketing performance metrics.

Your ultimate goal is to scale our digital marketing efforts and make Too Good To Go the #1 solution against Food Waste globally.

Your role


Maintain marketing tools and Infrastructure to ensure the highest standards of data quality and completeness.
Lead and manage cross-functional tool integration projects with Product, Tech, and Marketing teams, to design and implement a seamless, end-to-end data pipeline that integrates web and mobile platforms. Tools include web & product analytics platforms, mobile measurement platforms (e.g., Appsflyer), tag management and third-party integrations.
Support self-service analytics capabilities for the marketing team, help prioritize initiatives, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making to optimize spend and performance.
Lead efforts to enhance and optimize data used in attribution models, enabling deep insights into marketing spend performance and strategic decision-making.
Work closely with compliance teams to ensure marketing tools and practices adhere to GDPR, ePrivacy Directive and other relevant data regulations


Requirements


Full-stack & Technical Marketing Experience. With 5+ years in the industry and 3+ years in a similar role within a fast-paced environment, you bring a solid background in both full-stack and technical marketing.
SQL Proficiency. A strong command of SQL allows for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
Infrastructure Scaling. Experienced in optimizing and scaling data pipelines, API integrations, app measurement platforms, and CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce, GTM, Appsflyer, Amplitude/Mixpanel).
Data Analytics & BI Tools. Expertise in cleaning, normalizing, and analyzing data, with the ability to present insights clearly using BI tools.
Tech-Savvy & Forward-Looking. Always up to date with advancements in marketing technology and analytics, identifying opportunities for innovation and performance improvement.
Proactive & Pragmatic Mindset. Passionate, hands-on, and autonomous, always taking the initiative to get the job done.
Rigorous & Focused. Efficient, precise, and quick to iterate in solving complex problems.
Team Player. A strong communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical teams, translating abstract ideas into measurable actions.
Eco-Conscious. Truly passionate about sustainability and fighting food waste, recognizing the urgency of change and action for the planet.
Perfectly Fluent in English. Full working proficiency in English, ensuring seamless communication and documentation.


Nice to have


Marketing Metrics. You have experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics.
Attribution Modeling. You have experience modelling attribution, especially for mobile applications
AB Testing Experience. You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Graduate Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I am working with an exciting research consultancy looking for a Graduate Developer!




They are a forward-thinking company focused on revolutionizing the way biological data is analysed and shared, offering cutting-edge solutions to the research community. As they expand, they are looking for talented professionals to help build innovative software platforms that will drive scientific progress.










The Role




As the company continues to grow, they're looking to bring on a Graduate Developer to join their close-knit team of 10.




This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is due to graduate this summer and has a solid foundation in React and Next.js, whether through university projects, internships, or personal work. You'll work closely with backend developers to build and integrate new features and contribute to exciting client-driven projects from day one.




If you're passionate about development and eager to learn in a fast-paced, supportive environment, this is an amazing opportunity to start your career.




You will be working mostly on site in their Copenhagen office.




Benefits

Salary between 40K – 55K DKK per month
25 Days holiday
Paid lunch at the company office







If this role could be for you drop me an email at gabby.bergonzi@amicusjobs.co.uk

Title: Seeking a Process Data Scientist to our Process Science Analytics Team
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be

  • Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
  • Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
  • Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
  • Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
  • Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
  • Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
  • Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space


The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess

  • You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
  • You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
  • Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
  • It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.


We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about developing large enterprise solutions with the latest technology? Do you want to implement large cloud-based solutions in Microsoft Azure?

📍 Location: Ballerup, Aarhus

As a data engineer, you will develop and implement Azure-based solutions that improve data integration, data quality, and data flow to support business processes and strategies. You will be a key part of our projects from start to finish and contribute to decisions regarding technology selection that meets customer needs.

Your role

Responsibilities

In this role, you will help customers achieve their data and analytics strategy by setting up robust data warehouse and reporting solutions for processes such as finance, logistics, sales, manufacturing, projects and more. You will collaborate with developers, customers and business consultants to implement solutions on Azure. You will have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services and the Power BI Premium platform. A senior data engineer has extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data warehouses, ETL tools, SQL, APIs and data modeling. You understand complex requirements and thrive when transforming these into robust data flows and structured views with high data quality and where future changes can be easily implemented. In this role, you will manage how decisions within each area affect the overall solution. Responsibilities will include:


Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a variety of processes
Building the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a variety of sources
Write good, clean and efficient code
Use new technology like Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more
Create fast and accurate data models


Why is this a great job opportunity?

We focus on the latest trends in the market and Microsoft technology to ensure that we match the customer's needs to develop their own business with our technological insight. This means that you will work with the latest solutions for a future in the cloud. We want a lifelong customer relationship and work together with exciting companies, both locally and internationally. We are committed to following standards so that the solutions we deliver have a long life and are easy to develop as the customer's needs change.

Qualifications

Just like us, you are passionate about making the world more data-driven based on the latest technologies and methods.

To be successful in the role, we see that you have:


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud (AWS or Azure)
Experience with ETL processes, data warehousing and data modeling
Very good skills and experience with SQL
Speaks fluent Danish and English
Experience with developing SSIS, SSAS and Power BI and preferably Microsoft ERP
Proficiency in programming languages as Python, Java or Scala
Danish residency


Why become part of Columbus?

At Columbus, we care about each other as much as we care about our business. Therefore, we offer:


Not just a job, but a career: You will have access to a varied training program, including online and physical courses, to accelerate your career development and support your personal and professional growth
Belonging: At Columbus, we value teamwork and have a good collaborative environment. You will be part of a company where your colleagues have deep industry insight and a strong understanding of our customers' needs
Work-life Balance: The well-being of our employees is a priority. We want you to be the best version of yourself at work, so we offer high flexibility to shape your own workday
Global Impact: You will be part of a local and global team that is at the forefront of industry trends, with opportunities to influence and improve our service offerings on an international level


Become a part of Columbus!

You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV via the link. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Columbus

At Columbus, you’ll be joining a global IT consulting company with over 1,600 dedicated professionals. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, present in 7 countries helping 1,100 customers securing their future by driving growth through data-driven insights and creating seamless digital experiences.

With our broad industry experience in both B2B and complex B2C, we stand out as the leading digital sales partner in the Nordic region. You’ll be part of a team that designs and implements top-tier, industry-specific solutions, unleashing the full potential of our customers' digital businesses.

We believe in Digital transformation for a better tomorrow, where we also commit to drive positive social and environmental change on a global scale!

www.columbusglobal.com

Work at Columbus

Curious about life at Columbus? Check out our Instagram or LinkedIn feed to see our team in action, get insights into our culture, and discover what makes Columbus a great place to work!

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), IT Strategy & Digital Projects
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join a global leader in renewable energy infrastructure investments and get experience working with topics such as IT & Digital Strategy, Management of IT and Architecture? If so, Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) is the perfect place for you! We are currently looking for a new Student Assistant (internally called Analyst) to join our newly established IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team. Join us and be part of something big and exiting.

The team
We are the IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team, and we are looking for a new team member to join us in improving IT and supporting both the IT management team and our day-to-day activities. Our focus areas are:


Developing the IT & Digital Strategy to best support the business of CIP
Analysis of business and technology demand
Delivery of new Digital, Data & AI solutions and platforms
Supporting our Enterprise Architecture function
Working across IT and the business to ensure we deliver reliable IT solutions


The role
The position is part-time (expect 15-20 hours per week) and is based in our new Copenhagen office at the tip of Nordhavn.

Key work areas:

You will be joining a highly motivated IT department where you will get exposed to many different work areas and gain meaningful experience across the team and the wider organization to create top-quality IT. This can be a great first step in your future career. Your responsibilities will amongst others be to:


Create presentations and coordinate on IT management topics and other tactical and strategic needs
Participate in and contribute to delivery of projects and workshops
Support us on communication and change activities to improve business-IT alignment and further mature the organisation
Ad-hoc tasks such as analysis and research of technology trends, planning & coordination etc.
Deliver reports to management of IT and our users/customers
Coordinate and deliver in cooperation with analysts and associates in IT


You
We are looking for 2nd or 3rd year bachelor student or 1st year master’s student with great analytical skills. We expect that your education is centered on business and technology, e.g. digital, business-IT alignment, strategy or similar, for example: HA(IT), Cand.merc.(IT), or similar.

Preferred candidate is:


Proficient in English and Danish, with solid skills in written and spoken communication
Thriving with responsibility and wanting to deliver quality work, e.g. displaying attention to detail
Has interest in IT, digital, management of IT, and wanting to learn more
Curious and creative mindset with an ability to manage your own workload and handle your tasks effectively
Has experience with Excel and PowerPoint


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more

Do you want to join a global leader in renewable energy infrastructure investments and get experience working with topics such as IT & Digital Strategy, Management of IT and Architecture? If so, Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) is the perfect place for you! We are currently looking for a new Student Assistant (internally called Analyst) to join our newly established IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team. Join us and be part of something big and exiting.

The team
We are the IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team, and we are looking for a new team member to join us in improving IT and supporting both the IT management team and our day-to-day activities. Our focus areas are:

  • Developing the IT & Digital Strategy to best support the business of CIP
  • Analysis of business and technology demand
  • Delivery of new Digital, Data & AI solutions and platforms
  • Supporting our Enterprise Architecture function
  • Working across IT and the business to ensure we deliver reliable IT solutions

The role
The position is part-time (expect 15-20 hours per week) and is based in our new Copenhagen office at the tip of Nordhavn.

Key work areas:

You will be joining a highly motivated IT department where you will get exposed to many different work areas and gain meaningful experience across the team and the wider organization to create top-quality IT. This can be a great first step in your future career. Your responsibilities will amongst others be to:

  • Create presentations and coordinate on IT management topics and other tactical and strategic needs
  • Participate in and contribute to delivery of projects and workshops
  • Support us on communication and change activities to improve business-IT alignment and further mature the organisation
  • Ad-hoc tasks such as analysis and research of technology trends, planning & coordination etc.
  • Deliver reports to management of IT and our users/customers
  • Coordinate and deliver in cooperation with analysts and associates in IT

You
We are looking for 2nd or 3rd year bachelor student or 1st year master’s student with great analytical skills. We expect that your education is centered on business and technology, e.g. digital, business-IT alignment, strategy or similar, for example: HA(IT), Cand.merc.(IT), or similar.

Title: Data Engineer - Life Sciences
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ZS is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on improving life and how we live it, our most valuable asset is our people. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping life-changing solutions for patients, caregivers and consumers, worldwide. ZSers drive impact by bringing a client first mentality to each and every engagement. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop custom solutions and technology products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business. Bring your curiosity for learning; bold ideas; courage and passion to drive life-changing impact to ZS.

Our most valuable asset is our people.

At ZS we honor the visible and invisible elements of our identities, personal experiences and belief systems—the ones that comprise us as individuals, shape who we are and

make us unique. We believe your personal interests, identities, and desire to learn are part of your success here. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts and the networks ZS supports to assist our ZSers in cultivating community spaces, obtaining the resources they need to thrive, and sharing the messages they are passionate about.

Business Technology

ZS’s Technology group focuses on scalable strategies, assets and accelerators that deliver to our clients enterprise-wide transformation via cutting-edge technology. We leverage digital and technology solutions to optimize business processes, enhance decision-making, and drive innovation. Our services include, but are not limited to, Digital and Technology advisory, Product and Platform development and Data, Analytics and AI implementation.

What you’ll do as a Data Engineer:


Data Pipeline Development & Optimization
Design, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
Work with batch and real-time data processing frameworks (e.g., dbt, Azure, Apache Spark, Kafka, Databricks).
Ensure high availability, performance, and scalability of data workflows.
Cloud & Data Platform Engineering
Develop data solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Manage data lakehouse architectures and implement data warehousing strategies (Snowflake, Redshift).
Leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for automated provisioning (Terraform, CloudFormation).
Data Governance, Security & Compliance
Implement GxP, FAIR data principles, and data lineage tracking.
Work with RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) and data masking techniques to ensure compliance.
Ensure GDPR, HIPAA, and other regulatory alignment.
Collaboration & Business Integration
Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and business teams to enable AI, ML, and reporting use cases.
Develop APIs and data services for interoperability across platforms.
Optimize existing data architecture for cost efficiency and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) reduction.

What you’ll bring:


Strong expertise in Python, SQL, Spark, Scala.
Experience with ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, DBT) and workflow orchestration (Airflow, Prefect).
Hands-on knowledge of cloud-native data services (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, GCP Dataflow).
Familiarity with data modeling, data mesh, and MDM solutions.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, and MLOps integration.


Additional Skills:


Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related fields.
Prior experience in pharma, life sciences, or healthcare analytics
Strong ability to work in cross-functional teams and align with business priorities.


Perks & Benefits:

ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.

We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

Travel:

Travel is a requirement at ZS for client facing ZSers; business needs of your project and client are the priority. While some projects may be local, all client-facing ZSers should be prepared to travel as needed. Travel provides opportunities to strengthen client relationships, gain diverse experiences, and enhance professional growth by working in different environments and cultures.

Considering applying?

At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact and deliver better outcomes for all. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law.

To Complete Your Application:

Candidates must possess or be able to obtain work authorization for their intended country of employment.An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.

NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.

Find Out More At:

www.zs.com
Show more

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we’re looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you’ll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You’ll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the “why” behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You’ll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the ‘why’ behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click “Apply now” below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.


Show more

Title: Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics
Description:
Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics




About the Job

JOE & THE JUICE is entering a new phase of data-driven, scalable global growth. We are now looking for a sharp, strategic, and tech-savvy Senior Specialist - Growth Analytics to join our high-performing Growth team at our Global HQ in Copenhagen, supporting the growth journey of opening and operating +1,000 stores within the coming years.




Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard, you will play a central role in enabling decision-making, developing forecasting models, and driving AI integration across the business. This is a hands-on and highly visible position, giving you exposure to C-Level stakeholders and the opportunity to shape the analytical and strategic engine behind our international expansion.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain business-critical dashboards and forecasting models to support global expansion.
Establish performance and forecasting frameworks using tools like Snowflake and Power BI.
Automate reporting pipelines and deliver structured insights for leadership and Growth Committee reviews.
Act as the AI lead for the Growth team - identifying high-impact use cases and supporting implementation.
Translate strategic goals into measurable KPIs and ensure alignment with commercial objectives.
Champion data governance and help build the internal analytics infrastructure.
Provide decision support for real estate, budget planning, and cross-functional growth initiatives.
Collaborate with Real Estate, Finance, Legal, and Operations teams to drive performance and prioritization.
Guide junior analysts and contribute to building a high-performance team culture within Growth.




Key Qualifications

You have a Master’s degree in finance, business administration, or related fields
You have 4+ years of experience in analytics, consulting, strategy, or finance.
You’re highly proficient in Power BI, AI, Excel, and PowerPoint.
You have experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data platforms.
You can communicate complex insights clearly to both technical and commercial stakeholders.
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working cross-functionally.
You are commercially sharp, curious, and energized by building new systems and tools.




The Benefits

We offer a benefits package that includes a paid pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-ified benefits:

Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 160+ employees.
Our office facilities include a fully staffed JOE & THE JUICE bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice, and barista coffee.
Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
In Joe, we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings, and Friday bars.
Fitness facilities filled with all the equipment you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible showers with complimentary towels and a steam room.




The Process

We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible.

We will only consider applications through Easy Apply and will conduct interviews on a rolling basis.




If you have any questions, please direct them to our Chief Growth Officer, Sebastian Vestergaard. Please note that we cannot guarantee a response to personal requests or messages.




Read how we handle your data during the recruitment process here: https://www.joejuice.com/policy/recruitment-privacy-notice
