Title: Principal Statistician
Description:
Principal Statistician | Global CRO |Denmark| Home Based |

Award-winning global biometric CRO have multiple opportunities for experienced Principal Statisticians to join its growing team.

Partnering with top pharma, biotech, and medical device companies, they deliver high-quality biostatistics, programming, data management, and data science services. Principal Statisticians can either be a hands-on technical role or more focused on being a Lead Statistician and is a great opportunity to grow with a recognized CRO, gain pharma experience, and benefit from continuous learning and development.

What you will be doing:

You will be working as a statistician on clinical trials; producing and validating complex outputs to excellent quality whilst adhering to deliverable timelines.

being responsible for statistical aspects of reporting out study results. Working as a lead statistician across multiple studies, with the opportunity to oversee more junior leads and supporting regulatory interaction Cardiology experience is a plus.

What you will need:

Educated to PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, statistics or a related discipline
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry to have a good awareness of clinical trial issues, design, and implementation.
Familiarity with GCP and regulatory requirements
Experience of writing SAPs, protocols

What’s in it for you:

Recognized as an outstanding workplace, committed to employee engagement, satisfaction, and work-life balance.
Structured training, development plans, and a supportive, friendly environment.
Condensed hours for a shorter workweek.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fully remote role available in Denmark.

What to do next:

If this opportunity is of interest, please apply now with your CV as the organisation are looking to welcome Principal Statisticians onboard as soon as possible.

Not what you’re looking for?

Please contact Mark O'Brien at mark@warmanobrien.com for a confidential discussion about potential other opportunities in Denmark and across Europe.

Show more

Title: Senior/principal Power BI-konsulent søges til ambitiøst Business Analytics-team!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for alt, der rimer på Power BI – og kan du hjælpe virksomheder med at få mere værdi ud af deres løsninger gennem governance? Har du mindst 5 års erfaring som konsulent, og er du klar til at tage næste skridt i din karriere? Så er du måske vores nye senior/principal Power BI-konsulent på kontoret i København!




Hos dataon er vores fokus helt skarpt og vi arbejder udelukkende med data/BI projekter omkring Microsofts platform! Vores kunder er i forskellige brancher og der er rig mulighed for at blive udfordret og lære nyt. Din indsats gør en mærkbar forskel og du får mulighed for være med til at udvikle nye forretningsideer og nye områder. dataon har en flad organisationsstruktur hvor der er kort vej til de tre ejere, som er en aktiv del af virksomheden.




I Business Analytics-teamet brænder vi for alt, der rimer på Power BI. Kompetenceniveauet og kreativiteten er høj. Vi sparrer, deler viden og hjælper hinanden i mål. Vi arbejder både selvstændigt og i fællesskab – her er der højt til loftet, plads til grin og et stærkt fokus på faglig udvikling. Vores tone er uformel, og hverdagen byder på masser af variation – ingen dage er ens.




En af medarbejderne i teamet fortæller: "Hos dataon er der plads til faglig udvikling, spændende projekter og masser af hjælp fra dygtige kolleger – alt sammen i en social kultur med inspirerende ledere". 

- kunne det være noget for dig?




Om rollen

Som en del af vores Business Analytics-team kommer du til at:

Rådgive kunder om datadrevne beslutninger og Power BI-løsninger
Udvikle rapporter, semantiske modeller og Power Query-løsninger
Hjælpe kunder med at få mere værdi ud af Power BI ved hjælp af dataons Governance-model
Uddanne brugere og sikre værdiskabende implementeringer
Deltage i initiativer som pre-sale, events og marketing – vi er en mindre virksomhed, og du får mulighed for at sætte dit præg
Bidrage med små indlæg og artikler, hvis du har lyst




Hvem er du?

Vi leder efter dig, der:

Har mindst 5 års erfaring som konsulent med Power BI og datamodellering
Brænder for Power BI og følger med i de nyeste features og muligheder
Kan omsætte forretningskrav til konkrete og brugbare løsninger
Kan tage ansvar for leverancer og sikre høj kvalitet
Er proaktiv, ansvarlig, team orienteret – og motiveres af at gøre en forskel




Hvad vi tilbyder

 Hos dataon bliver du en del af et dedikeret team med høj faglighed, fleksibilitet og fokus på udvikling. Vi har:

En dynamisk organisation med korte beslutningsveje.
Ca. 40 engagerede kollegaer, der stræber efter banebrydende løsninger.
Et arbejdsmiljø, hvor teamspirit og innovation går hånd i hånd.
Show more

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), Global Project Management Office
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Student Analyst to join Global Project Management Office team in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The role
As a Student Assistant (internally called Analyst), you will have the exciting opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a real-world setting. You will collaborate with highly qualified and experienced professionals in our Global Project Management Office (PMO), while contributing to our successful project delivery.

In this role, you will be engaged in various project management and project delivery-related activities alongside your colleagues. Your key responsibilities will be to assist in developing of a potential implementation of a strategic portfolio management tool, including everything from stakeholder mapping, identifying key user groups, conducting market screening for potential vendors and preparing the business case for approval. In addition, you will be responsible for finding ways for easy tracking of key project milestones, data management, and presentation of these in a simple and automated manner. You will also perform various types of analyses using Excel and Power BI to support informed decision-making and assist with ad hoc tasks as needed together with the entire team.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Support scoping, defining, and preparing business case for a strategic portfolio mgmt. tool
Collect and maintain data used to conduct portfolio overviews, tracking key decision gates and phases
Closely collaborate and support our team members within their areas of responsibility
Assistance with presentations and communication material


This part-time Analyst position requires approximately 15-20 hours per week, while you are enrolled at a university. We value flexibility, so your workload may vary, and we expect both you and the team to adjust accordingly. You will report directly to a team member, who will provide you with mentorship and guidance as you embark on this exciting journey with us.

You
We are looking for a candidate, either in the 1st year of a Master’s or in the last year of a Bachelor’s degree, who plans to pursue a relevant master’s degree in, for example (but not limited to) Project Management, General Management and Analytics (cand.merc.), Business, Engineering or Energy (MSc).

You are a responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly dynamic, effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate:

High academic performer with solid analytical skills
Thrives with taking initiative and ownership, while also demonstrating high attention to detail
Fluent in English, with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel (experience with Power BI would be beneficial)
Cooperative colleague with solid written and verbal communication skills


Please, note that we don't have remote work opportunities, therefore only students residing in Denmark (or planning to move here for the Master's degree), will be considered.

The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: CRM Analyst
Place: Farum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Change Lingerie is looking for a motivated and detail-oriented CRM Analyst to manage and optimize customer relationships through our Customer Data Platform. In this role, you'll be a key driver of our day-to-day CRM activities, develop customer segmentation strategies, and provide insights to improve customer engagement, loyalty, and sales across all channels. You will be a self-starter ready to drive multiple projects enhancing our current CRM system and customer experiences.

This position combines CRM system management with customer data analysis, offering you the opportunity to work closely with our wider marketing functions to help deliver personalized, data-driven experiences that enhance our customers’ satisfaction and retention. This position reports into the Senior Customer Insights Manager.

Key Responsibilities

CRM Management:


Assist with the day-to-day operations of our CRM platform, Bloomreach, including user setup, permissions, and troubleshooting.
Help configure and optimize customer journeys, workflows, and triggered communications to improve customer engagement.
Support the integration of CRM with other marketing and e-commerce tools to ensure smooth data flow.


Customer Segmentation & Targeting:


Drive development of customer segments based on purchase history, engagement patterns, and demographics.
Support the marketing team by providing targeted customer audiences for campaigns, loyalty programs, and retention efforts.


Analytics & Reporting:


Monitor CRM KPIs such as engagement rates, purchase frequency, consent and Customer Lifetime Value (CLV).
Assist with the creation of reports and dashboards to track customer behavior and campaign performance.
Provide data insights to support strategies for improving personalization, retention, and conversion rates.


Cross-Team Collaboration:


Work closely with the Marketing, E-commerce, and Web development teams to ensure CRM strategies align with broader business goals.
Support the marketing team by providing data insights that help refine marketing campaigns and customer targeting.


Data Management & Quality Control:


Maintain accurate, clean, and well-organized customer data within Bloomreach.
Implement data hygiene practices to keep our customer database clean and accurate.
Perform regular audits to ensure data consistency and relevance for CRM campaigns.


Key Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in CRM coordination or management, customer data analysis, or related fields (internships or relevant projects are a plus).
Experience with Bloomreach or similar CRM platforms.
Understanding of customer segmentation, lifecycle marketing, and data management best practices.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to create reports or dashboards.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI or similar).
Attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and strong communication skills.
Experience or interest in the fashion, beauty, lingerie, or retail industry is a plus.


What We Offer


A great opportunity to continue your career in CRM and data analysis with an international retail brand with a strong focus on driving value in CRM.
A supportive and collaborative work environment where you’ll learn and grow professionally.
Exposure to cutting-edge CRM and personalization technologies like Bloomreach.
Competitive salary, pension plan and health insurance
Great daily lunch


We are looking forward to receiving your application

We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously. Please use our recruitment system and the "Apply for position"-button. Applications sent via email will not be handled.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team - a team focused on instrumenting and using data to enable better product decisions and opportunities.

You’ll be bringing your perspectives and recommendations on our business and customers to help drive better decisions for our product, and communicate and influence teams and stakeholders through close collaboration.

Veo is in a foundational stage in how we approach building a shared understanding of metrics, baselines and drivers, and so you will play a key role in ensuring proper instrumentation and tracking, as well as ensuring that teams have common metrics which best align with goals and are build with an eye towards reusability.

What You'll Do


Common Metrics & KPIs: Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product goals - ensuring they’re reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams
Quantitative Research & Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses and experiments to verify product opportunities, making data-driven recommendations that inform our roadmap
Instrumentation & Event Tracking: Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Cross-Functional Alignment: Ensure all relevant teams—product, marketing, engineering, etc. - have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives




What You Could Bring


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Looker, Amplitude, Segment or similar tools
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Values we hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
Show more

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about developing large enterprise solutions with the latest technology? Do you want to implement large cloud-based solutions in Microsoft Azure?

📍 Location: Ballerup, Aarhus

As a data engineer, you will develop and implement Azure-based solutions that improve data integration, data quality, and data flow to support business processes and strategies. You will be a key part of our projects from start to finish and contribute to decisions regarding technology selection that meets customer needs.

Your role

Responsibilities

In this role, you will help customers achieve their data and analytics strategy by setting up robust data warehouse and reporting solutions for processes such as finance, logistics, sales, manufacturing, projects and more. You will collaborate with developers, customers and business consultants to implement solutions on Azure. You will have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services and the Power BI Premium platform. A senior data engineer has extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data warehouses, ETL tools, SQL, APIs and data modeling. You understand complex requirements and thrive when transforming these into robust data flows and structured views with high data quality and where future changes can be easily implemented. In this role, you will manage how decisions within each area affect the overall solution. Responsibilities will include:


Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a variety of processes
Building the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a variety of sources
Write good, clean and efficient code
Use new technology like Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more
Create fast and accurate data models


Why is this a great job opportunity?

We focus on the latest trends in the market and Microsoft technology to ensure that we match the customer's needs to develop their own business with our technological insight. This means that you will work with the latest solutions for a future in the cloud. We want a lifelong customer relationship and work together with exciting companies, both locally and internationally. We are committed to following standards so that the solutions we deliver have a long life and are easy to develop as the customer's needs change.

Qualifications

Just like us, you are passionate about making the world more data-driven based on the latest technologies and methods.

To be successful in the role, we see that you have:


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud (AWS or Azure)
Experience with ETL processes, data warehousing and data modeling
Very good skills and experience with SQL
Speaks fluent Danish and English
Experience with developing SSIS, SSAS and Power BI and preferably Microsoft ERP
Proficiency in programming languages as Python, Java or Scala
Danish residency


Why become part of Columbus?

At Columbus, we care about each other as much as we care about our business. Therefore, we offer:


Not just a job, but a career: You will have access to a varied training program, including online and physical courses, to accelerate your career development and support your personal and professional growth
Belonging: At Columbus, we value teamwork and have a good collaborative environment. You will be part of a company where your colleagues have deep industry insight and a strong understanding of our customers' needs
Work-life Balance: The well-being of our employees is a priority. We want you to be the best version of yourself at work, so we offer high flexibility to shape your own workday
Global Impact: You will be part of a local and global team that is at the forefront of industry trends, with opportunities to influence and improve our service offerings on an international level


Become a part of Columbus!

You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV via the link. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Columbus

At Columbus, you’ll be joining a global IT consulting company with over 1,600 dedicated professionals. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, present in 7 countries helping 1,100 customers securing their future by driving growth through data-driven insights and creating seamless digital experiences.

With our broad industry experience in both B2B and complex B2C, we stand out as the leading digital sales partner in the Nordic region. You’ll be part of a team that designs and implements top-tier, industry-specific solutions, unleashing the full potential of our customers' digital businesses.

We believe in Digital transformation for a better tomorrow, where we also commit to drive positive social and environmental change on a global scale!

www.columbusglobal.com

Work at Columbus

Curious about life at Columbus? Check out our Instagram or LinkedIn feed to see our team in action, get insights into our culture, and discover what makes Columbus a great place to work!


Show more

Title: Analyst (Student Assistant), IT Strategy & Digital Projects
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join a global leader in renewable energy infrastructure investments and get experience working with topics such as IT & Digital Strategy, Management of IT and Architecture? If so, Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) is the perfect place for you! We are currently looking for a new Student Assistant (internally called Analyst) to join our newly established IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team. Join us and be part of something big and exiting.

The team
We are the IT Strategy & Enterprise Architecture team, and we are looking for a new team member to join us in improving IT and supporting both the IT management team and our day-to-day activities. Our focus areas are:


Developing the IT & Digital Strategy to best support the business of CIP
Analysis of business and technology demand
Delivery of new Digital, Data & AI solutions and platforms
Supporting our Enterprise Architecture function
Working across IT and the business to ensure we deliver reliable IT solutions


The role
The position is part-time (expect 15-20 hours per week) and is based in our new Copenhagen office at the tip of Nordhavn.

Key work areas:

You will be joining a highly motivated IT department where you will get exposed to many different work areas and gain meaningful experience across the team and the wider organization to create top-quality IT. This can be a great first step in your future career. Your responsibilities will amongst others be to:


Create presentations and coordinate on IT management topics and other tactical and strategic needs
Participate in and contribute to delivery of projects and workshops
Support us on communication and change activities to improve business-IT alignment and further mature the organisation
Ad-hoc tasks such as analysis and research of technology trends, planning & coordination etc.
Deliver reports to management of IT and our users/customers
Coordinate and deliver in cooperation with analysts and associates in IT


You
We are looking for 2nd or 3rd year bachelor student or 1st year master’s student with great analytical skills. We expect that your education is centered on business and technology, e.g. digital, business-IT alignment, strategy or similar, for example: HA(IT), Cand.merc.(IT), or similar.

Preferred candidate is:


Proficient in English and Danish, with solid skills in written and spoken communication
Thriving with responsibility and wanting to deliver quality work, e.g. displaying attention to detail
Has interest in IT, digital, management of IT, and wanting to learn more
Curious and creative mindset with an ability to manage your own workload and handle your tasks effectively
Has experience with Excel and PowerPoint


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

---

Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

For more information, please visit cisc.dk.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
dataon er et førende konsulent- og projekthus, der leverer rådgivning og udvikling inden for dataplatform og -løsninger. Med kontorer i København og Århus hjælper vi vores kunder med at udnytte deres data til at træffe kvalificerede beslutninger og skabe værdi.




Vores team består af dygtige og passionerede fagfolk, der arbejder med de nyeste teknologier og metoder inden for datahåndtering.




Typiske opgaver:

Design og implementering af data pipelines ved hjælp af Databricks og Microsofts dataplatform.
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af dataplatforme for at sikre effektiv dataindsamling, -transformation og -indlæsning.
Samarbejde med dataanalytikere og forretningsenheder for at forstå deres databehov og levere skræddersyede løsninger.
Deltagelse i udviklingen af data governance og sikkerhedsstandarder.




Kvalifikationer:

Erfaring med Databricks og Microsofts dataplatform (Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, etc.).
Stærke færdigheder i SQL og Python.
Erfaring med ETL-processer og data pipeline design.
Kendskab til data governance og sikkerhedsstandarder.
Gode kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner.
Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og i teams.




Hvis du er en erfaren data engineer, der brænder for at arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og skabe værdi gennem data, vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være en del af et team, hvor humøret er højt og ambitionerne store? Hos NORRIQ søger vi nemlig to nye kollegaer til vores Data & AI-team på lokationerne i enten Aalborg eller Valby – kom og vær med til at skabe spændende, digitale løsninger i et stærkt IT-konsulenthus 🚀




Som Data Engineer i Data & AI bliver du en del af et stærkt sammentømret hold, som er et af markedets stærkeste teams inden for Data Platform-løsninger. Sammen har vi masser af erfaring med at udvikle og implementere de bedste løsninger til vores kunder. Hos os finder du et arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er fokus på faglig og personlig udvikling. I teamet vil du opleve et miljø med masser af sparring, grin og opbakning, så du får de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i rollen 👏




Dine arbejdsopgaver vil være, men ikke udelukkende indeholde:

Udvikling af data-løsninger: Omsætte kundernes behov til datadrevne indsigter ved hjælp af den nyeste Microsoft-teknologi, såsom Power BI, Fabric og Azure. Du vil designe og skabe dashboards, rapporter og datamodeller, der giver kunderne klarhed og nye perspektiver på deres forretning 💪
Vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer: Sørge for værdifuld og effektiv drift af vores kunders løsninger ved at tilsikre, at vores eksisterende kunders løsninger fortsat kører problemfrit og udvikler sig i takt med deres behov 📈
Tværfagligt samarbejde: Her vil du have en udførende rolle, hvor du har hænderne dybt i maskinrummet med mange forskellige kunder, opgaver og nye teknologier. Du vil aldrig stå alene med kunderne, men arbejde tæt sammen med kollegaer på tværs af fagområder for at sikre en dyb forståelse af kundernes behov og levere optimale, skræddersyede løsninger 🤝




Vi forestiller os, du kommer med:

Måske du er nogle år inde i din data karriere? Måske du nærmere anskuer dig som senior? Det vigtigste er at du har god erfaring inden for dataanalyse og systemudvikling, og at du er klar til at bidrage med din viden i vores team 👩‍💻
God erfaring med DAX, opbygning af semantiske modeller i Power BI og så er du selvfølgelig en haj til SQL 🦈
Kendskab til Azure DataFactory Piplines og/eller SQL Server Integration Services, samt en god forståelse for Git og CI/CD-processer i Azure DevOps 🧠





Men hvorfor skal du søge:

Vækstambitioner: I Data & AI er ambitionerne for fremtiden store – og en ny æra venter forude. Vi arbejder ikke kun med de nyeste teknologier; vores ambition er at være på forkant med fremtidens teknologier og konstant udforske ny viden, der kan forme morgendagens løsninger. Her har vi særligt arbejdet med AI for øje, og hvordan NORRIQ i højere grad kan tilbyde AI-løsninger til vores kunder 🤖. Vækst står også højt på dagsordenen i vores Data & AI-team. Vores vision er at fordoble antallet af medarbejdere inden for en kort årrække. Samtidig med at vi også kigger ind i større og mere komplekse projekter 👏
Din udvikling: I vores team stræber vi efter at blive dygtigere – både individuelt og som team. Her er der fokus på, at du kan blive ved med at udvikle din faglighed, bl.a. gennem relevante certificeringer, intern vidensdeling og sparring, samt at du kan få lov til at dykke ned i dine faglige interesser og den nyeste teknologi – så du/vi altid er på forkant med markedets udvikling 👩‍💻
Fleksibilitet: Hos NORRIQ får du en unik mulighed for ikke bare at have traditionel fleksibilitet ift. hjemmearbejde, samt indflydelse på hvordan du tilrettelægger din arbejdsdag, arbejdssted og din tid 🙋‍♀️. Her kan du være med til at forme dit eget job, tage ansvar og ejerskab, når du i samarbejde med dine kolleger i teamet skaber synlige succeser for kunderne. I stillingen som Data Engineer i Data & AI vægter din mening højt, og du har afgørende betydning for NORRIQ’s fremtidige udvikling 🙌






Har vi fanget din interesse?

Vi har gjort det nemt og hurtigt for dig at søge en stilling hos NORRIQ. Derfor beder vi hverken om motiverede ansøgninger eller sætter dig til at udfylde lange spørgeskemaer. Så send dit CV allerede i dag. Du kan søge jobbet gennem formularen nederst på siden👇👇👇

Show more
HTML:
Vil du være en del af et team, hvor humøret er højt og ambitionerne store? Hos NORRIQ søger vi nemlig to nye kollegaer til vores Data & AI-team på lokationerne i enten Aalborg eller Valby – kom og vær med til at skabe spændende, digitale løsninger i et stærkt IT-konsulenthus 🚀


Som Data Engineer i Data & AI bliver du en del af et stærkt sammentømret hold, som er et af markedets stærkeste teams inden for Data Platform-løsninger. Sammen har vi masser af erfaring med at udvikle og implementere de bedste løsninger til vores kunder. Hos os finder du et arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er fokus på faglig og personlig udvikling. I teamet vil du opleve et miljø med masser af sparring, grin og opbakning, så du får de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i rollen 👏


Dine arbejdsopgaver vil være, men ikke udelukkende indeholde:

  • Udvikling af data-løsninger: Omsætte kundernes behov til datadrevne indsigter ved hjælp af den nyeste Microsoft-teknologi, såsom Power BI, Fabric og Azure. Du vil designe og skabe dashboards, rapporter og datamodeller, der giver kunderne klarhed og nye perspektiver på deres forretning 💪
  • Vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer: Sørge for værdifuld og effektiv drift af vores kunders løsninger ved at tilsikre, at vores eksisterende kunders løsninger fortsat kører problemfrit og udvikler sig i takt med deres behov 📈
  • Tværfagligt samarbejde: Her vil du have en udførende rolle, hvor du har hænderne dybt i maskinrummet med mange forskellige kunder, opgaver og nye teknologier. Du vil aldrig stå alene med kunderne, men arbejde tæt sammen med kollegaer på tværs af fagområder for at sikre en dyb forståelse af kundernes behov og levere optimale, skræddersyede løsninger 🤝


Vi forestiller os, du kommer med:

  • Måske du er nogle år inde i din data karriere? Måske du nærmere anskuer dig som senior? Det vigtigste er at du har god erfaring inden for dataanalyse og systemudvikling, og at du er klar til at bidrage med din viden i vores team 👩‍💻
  • God erfaring med DAX, opbygning af semantiske modeller i Power BI og så er du selvfølgelig en haj til SQL 🦈
  • Kendskab til Azure DataFactory Piplines og/eller SQL Server Integration Services, samt en god forståelse for Git og CI/CD-processer i Azure DevOps 🧠



Men hvorfor skal du søge:

  • Vækstambitioner: I Data & AI er ambitionerne for fremtiden store – og en ny æra venter forude. Vi arbejder ikke kun med de nyeste teknologier; vores ambition er at være på forkant med fremtidens teknologier og konstant udforske ny viden, der kan forme morgendagens løsninger. Her har vi særligt arbejdet med AI for øje, og hvordan NORRIQ i højere grad kan tilbyde AI-løsninger til vores kunder 🤖. Vækst står også højt på dagsordenen i vores Data & AI-team. Vores vision er at fordoble antallet af medarbejdere inden for en kort årrække. Samtidig med at vi også kigger ind i større og mere komplekse projekter 👏
  • Din udvikling: I vores team stræber vi efter at blive dygtigere – både individuelt og som team. Her er der fokus på, at du kan blive ved med at udvikle din faglighed, bl.a. gennem relevante certificeringer, intern vidensdeling og sparring, samt at du kan få lov til at dykke ned i dine faglige interesser og den nyeste teknologi – så du/vi altid er på forkant med markedets udvikling 👩‍💻
  • Fleksibilitet: Hos NORRIQ får du en unik mulighed for ikke bare at have traditionel fleksibilitet ift. hjemmearbejde, samt indflydelse på hvordan du tilrettelægger din arbejdsdag, arbejdssted og din tid 🙋‍♀️. Her kan du være med til at forme dit eget job, tage ansvar og ejerskab, når du i samarbejde med dine kolleger i teamet skaber synlige succeser for kunderne. I stillingen som Data Engineer i Data & AI vægter din mening højt, og du har afgørende betydning for NORRIQ’s fremtidige udvikling 🙌




Har vi fanget din interesse?

Vi har gjort det nemt og hurtigt for dig at søge en stilling hos NORRIQ. Derfor beder vi hverken om motiverede ansøgninger eller sætter dig til at udfylde lange spørgeskemaer. Så send dit CV allerede i dag. Du kan søge jobbet gennem formularen nederst på siden👇👇👇

Title: Data Engineer - Life Sciences
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ZS is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on improving life and how we live it, our most valuable asset is our people. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping life-changing solutions for patients, caregivers and consumers, worldwide. ZSers drive impact by bringing a client first mentality to each and every engagement. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop custom solutions and technology products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business. Bring your curiosity for learning; bold ideas; courage and passion to drive life-changing impact to ZS.

Our most valuable asset is our people.

At ZS we honor the visible and invisible elements of our identities, personal experiences and belief systems—the ones that comprise us as individuals, shape who we are and

make us unique. We believe your personal interests, identities, and desire to learn are part of your success here. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts and the networks ZS supports to assist our ZSers in cultivating community spaces, obtaining the resources they need to thrive, and sharing the messages they are passionate about.

Business Technology

ZS’s Technology group focuses on scalable strategies, assets and accelerators that deliver to our clients enterprise-wide transformation via cutting-edge technology. We leverage digital and technology solutions to optimize business processes, enhance decision-making, and drive innovation. Our services include, but are not limited to, Digital and Technology advisory, Product and Platform development and Data, Analytics and AI implementation.

What you’ll do as a Data Engineer:


Data Pipeline Development & Optimization
Design, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
Work with batch and real-time data processing frameworks (e.g., dbt, Azure, Apache Spark, Kafka, Databricks).
Ensure high availability, performance, and scalability of data workflows.
Cloud & Data Platform Engineering
Develop data solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Manage data lakehouse architectures and implement data warehousing strategies (Snowflake, Redshift).
Leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for automated provisioning (Terraform, CloudFormation).
Data Governance, Security & Compliance
Implement GxP, FAIR data principles, and data lineage tracking.
Work with RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) and data masking techniques to ensure compliance.
Ensure GDPR, HIPAA, and other regulatory alignment.
Collaboration & Business Integration
Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and business teams to enable AI, ML, and reporting use cases.
Develop APIs and data services for interoperability across platforms.
Optimize existing data architecture for cost efficiency and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) reduction.

What you’ll bring:


Strong expertise in Python, SQL, Spark, Scala.
Experience with ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, DBT) and workflow orchestration (Airflow, Prefect).
Hands-on knowledge of cloud-native data services (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, GCP Dataflow).
Familiarity with data modeling, data mesh, and MDM solutions.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, and MLOps integration.


Additional Skills:


Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related fields.
Prior experience in pharma, life sciences, or healthcare analytics
Strong ability to work in cross-functional teams and align with business priorities.


Perks & Benefits:

ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.

We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

Travel:

Travel is a requirement at ZS for client facing ZSers; business needs of your project and client are the priority. While some projects may be local, all client-facing ZSers should be prepared to travel as needed. Travel provides opportunities to strengthen client relationships, gain diverse experiences, and enhance professional growth by working in different environments and cultures.

Considering applying?

At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact and deliver better outcomes for all. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law.

To Complete Your Application:

Candidates must possess or be able to obtain work authorization for their intended country of employment.An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.

NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.

Find Out More At:

www.zs.com
Show more

Title: Master Data Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive in the field between IT, data, and business? Can you optimize business processes/flows and define solutions and architecture for some of Scandinavia’s most ambitious manufactures, brands and retailers? Then it might be you we are looking for as a Business Analyst for our PIM/Cloud Department to our office in Aarhus/Copenhagen




About the job

As a Master Data Consultant in our Product Information Management (PIM) team, you will play a key role in helping our customers optimize their data and processes by shaping solid strategies that bridge business needs with IT architecture.

You will be part of a skilled consulting team that supports clients in defining and implementing PIM/DAM systems. Your work will involve data analysis, data modeling, and process design - always aligned with the customer’s strategy, requirements, and architecture.

Workdays and locations will vary depending on your projects. Some days you will be immersed in focused tasks while other days will revolve around collaboration - whether remotely or on-site with customers.




Your primary responsibilities will include:

Advising and supporting customers in optimizing their product data setup.
Technically configuring PIM/DAM systems to meet business needs.
Analyzing data structures and business processes.
Facilitating workshops to define and align requirements.
Developing solution proposals and presenting alternatives.
Consulting and educating customers on how to effectively use their PIM solutions.
Automating data flows and processes, including AI-driven solutions.
Preparing clear project documentation, including business requirements and IT architecture.
Ensuring governance and driving best practices in internal processes related to IT strategy and architecture.







YOUR PROFILE

We are looking for someone who is naturally curious, analytical, and ready to grow. With a sharp analytical mindset, and a natural interest for connecting business and IT, you thrive on turning complexity into clarity.




Whether you just started your career or have a few years of experience, what matters most is your drive and interest in data, digital processes, and creating value for customers.




We also expect you to bring:

A structured and analytical mindset with the ability to keep an overview without losing sight of important details
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate complex topics to various stakeholders
A drive to learn and take initiative, and a proactive mindset toward solving problems
The ability to build trust and strong relationships with both clients and colleagues
A quality-conscious and ambitious approach to your work
A preference for collaboration and an open, informal tone in your daily work
Fluency in Danish and/or Swedish is a plus
Possibly a few years of experience as a consultant, business analyst, or project manager.
Possibly a background such as cand.IT, cand.merc., ITKO, cand.merc. Information Management, ICT Engineering or similar.




Life at impact

For more than 20 years, IMPACT has pioneered some of the most advanced commerce solutions in the Nordics. What started in Aarhus, Denmark has grown into a European powerhouse with offices across the world.




While we cover all the major tech platforms and work with some of the most exciting businesses, we make a sincere effort to stay down-to-earth. It’s who we are, and it’s the kind of talent we want to attract. We empower people and businesses to drive positive change and quality experiences, and we’re not afraid to take the lead on shaping the future of commerce.




Today, we’re a global team of digital talents working to strategize, craft, and support all things tech. We push the boundaries for commerce with curiosity, ambition, and empowerment that cements the ambition to change commerce for the better. But it’s not all about size. Because more than anything, we want to maintain our collective can-do attitude that creates a working environment where everything is possible – and have fun while doing it.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Senior Analyst / Manager, Strategic Planning & Intelligence
Description:
Are you passionate about making a tangible impact and want to tackle real-world challenges where sustainability meets profit?

Join Grundfos as an Analyst / Manager in our Group Strategy function and embark on our journey to become the leading provider of intelligent water and climate solutions globally!

This is a highly attractive opportunity for a driven individual with at least 1–2 years of professional experience (e.g. from a consultancy, a large complex organisation, or a startup) – or a standout professional with a proven track record of excellence. The perfect place to accelerate your career in a dynamic and purpose-driven environment.

In this position you will be based in Bjerringbro and you will report to the Head of Strategic Planning & Intelligence.

What is the job about?

As a Senior Analyst / Manager you will be part of Grundfos’ Strategic Planning & Intelligence team, one of three pillars of the Group Strategy function. We collaborate closely across the three teams, and you will work alongside 25 highly skilled colleagues. We are more than 10 different nationalities with varied educational and professional backgrounds, including long-term Grundfos specialists, former top-tier consultants, and former participants of the Grundfos Global Graduate Programme. Together, we solve key challenges at the top of the agenda of our C-suite, ensuring Grundfos remains at the forefront of innovation, sustainability, and social impact.

Furthermore, you will:


Work on strategic market intelligence projects across the entire Grundfos organisation.
Contribute to other strategic projects in areas such as corporate strategy, growth initiatives, sustainability, digitalisation and M&A.
Deliver impact in collaboration with diverse stakeholders across the organisation, from senior leadership to sales, business development and engineering teams.
Develop recommendations and drive implementation to ensure our strategies translate into measurable results.
Gain unparalleled exposure to Grundfos’ global operations while honing your consulting, research, project management and problem-solving skills.


Your background:

We are searching for top talent with the ambition to grow and the mindset to thrive in a dynamic, high-impact environment.

For an Analyst role, you do not need to be an accomplished strategy specialist yet, because together, we will turn you into one. You could be an engineer, business graduate, or social scientist with:


A strong academic record and a master's degree in business administration, finance, strategy, economics, engineering, or a related field.
1–2 years of work experience in an international business environment.
A growth mindset—you’re a proven learner, curious, and eager to continuously improve.
Excellent analytical skills and eagerness to navigate complex challenges.
Great communication and collaboration, ability to engage with stakeholders across functions and cultures.


For a Manager role, in addition to the above, you have:


Minimum of 5 years of experience in market intelligence, management consulting, or corporate strategy, with exposure to senior management and cross-functional work.
Proven track record leading complex research or consulting projects within a large international business environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects with conflicting deadlines and influence stakeholders at various levels.


Position level and compensation will be discussed with the successful candidate.

What’s in it for you?

Whether it’s developing skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive and trusting environment, where we benefit from sparring and using each other’s competence to deliver on our projects and commitments to the organization guided by six core values.

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:


Flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice.
Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programs.
Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development.
Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly.


Do you want to learn more?

If you have questions or would like to know more about this position, please contact Hiring Manager Andrei Melnikov, Head of Strategic Planning & Intelligence at +4542111526.

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply” today, and no later than June 1st, 2025.

We look forward to hearing from you.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Retail Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you want to play a meaningful role in elevating our global franchising business, making better decisions with data and analytics at the heart of everything we do?

LEGO Certified Stores (LCS) are fully branded LEGO Stores owned & operated by our global network of Partners and will number 1,000 stores by the end of 2026.

Join our growing team as a Retail Analyst and help build critical retail capabilities, delivering on the ambition of making LEGO® Branded Stores the pinnacle shopping and brand experience for our consumers.


Core Responsibilities

As a Retail Analyst within the Branded Channels Team, you will play an important role in ensuring that Analytics & Insight become the bedrock for decision making, using our data to drive faster and better decisions that will enable sustainable growth for Partner Channels.

You will collaborate with our Location Planning teams, global Analytics & Insights functions, and Channel Leads worldwide, delivering insights to support critical store network decisions. In this commercial role, you will analyse various data points related to store performance and provide the right information to the right people, when needed. This will empower them to focus on key performance levers that drive continuous improvements in our in-store commercial performance.

You will support the development, facilitation and successful implementation of the Store Location Planning Model, continuously improving our data integrity and solutions to ensure relevance and efficiency. This entails





Working with Retail Development Teams to analyse and interpret store performance data; highlight key trends and understand commercial implications
Provide insights that will inform store network decisions, e.g sales and profitability thresholds, identify key drivers of performance
Support Branded Channel Teams globally to make better informed data led decisions. e.g. trend analysis, performance measurement, campaign tracking
Manage defined set of performance dashboards, liaising with Analytics & Insight team to optimize relevant data sets
Supporting key business priorities such as Store Portfolio Segmentation, Trade Investments, and Store Estate Optimisations to drive strategic decision making across all branded channels
Developing reporting solutions and supporting the ingestion and sharing of key performance metrics to find opportunities and aid sales growth
Support the commercial strategy process and global branded channel alignment




Play your part in our team succeeding

Working independently and across all Regions and many internal functions, the successful candidate needs to possess excellent stakeholder management skills.

As Retail Analyst, you will play a key role in further strengthening the Value Proposition towards our Partners. By building a strong understanding of our entire branded retail business, you will help drive critical improvement in close collaboration with key collaborators from right across our Commercial Organisation.

Do you have what it takes?

The successful candidate comes with experience in retail or franchise sales with proven understanding of merchandising, finance, logistics, and store operations. Furthermore, you come with





Ability to analyse and interpret store performance data; highlight key trends and understand commercial implications.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, with a strong analytical capability and the ability to summarise complex data in a clear and concise way.
Experience using or familiarity with spatial and BI tools such as QGIS, ArcGIS, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI.
Proven experience in retail analytics dealing with store performance and manipulating data to develop compelling arguments.
Relevant retail industry sector knowledge or experience of working in a consultancy supporting retailers.
Understanding of retail location planning techniques and analysis; statistical models / spatial models / sales transfer (cannibalisation) modelling.
Strong collaborative & project management skills that enable you to support numerous tasks and projects simultaneously.
A commercial approach with quantitative and analytical skills allowing you to extract insights and meaningful conclusions from complex business problems.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Robotics Data Collector - Quality Assurance – Get Paid to Help Improve AI!
Description:
Click Here to Apply ﻿

📢 Now Hiring: Robotics Data Collector - Quality Assurance – Get Paid to Help Improve AI! 📢

🚀 Join a cutting-edge AI project and earn money from home while contributing to the future of artificial intelligence!

📂 About The Project

Are you passionate about AI and technology? This is a unique opportunity to work in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning industry while earning money from home! We are looking for individuals to participate in a large-scale AI data collection and quality assurance project.

Your role? Wear innovative wearable technology to record daily activities and help train AI models for improved real-world understanding. You’ll also have the chance to review and label machine-learning data, ensuring high-quality standards are met.

📝 Responsibilities

🔹 Attend a one-time, in-person onboarding session in Mexico City.

🔹 Wear hand-mounted cameras and capture high-quality video recordings of various everyday tasks.

🔹 Ensure recordings follow the required technical specifications.

🔹 Perform and document diverse activities (cooking, organizing, using tools, etc.).

🔹 Label machine-learning data (text, pictures, videos, or 3D models, depending on project needs).

🔹 Conduct post-process audits and write error reports on data quality.

🔹 Identify and resolve the root cause of low-quality data, providing feedback for improvements.

🔹 Help establish best practices and optimize project workflows.

🔹 Upload collected data on time each week.

🔹 Handle and return provided recording equipment (cameras, grippers, SD cards).

✅ Preferred Qualifications

✔️ No prior experience needed—anyone can apply!

✔️ Comfortable wearing hand-mounted recording devices for extended periods.

✔️ Strong attention to detail and ability to follow precise recording instructions.

✔️ Reliable access to a stable home environment for filming.

✔️ Good computer skills (ability to work efficiently on a computer).

✔️ Availability to work a minimum of 30 to 40 hours per week.

✔️ Strong communication and teamwork skills.

✔️ Advanced English skills.

💡 Nice to Haves

✨ Experience with video recording or tech gadgets.

✨ Data labeling or previous quality assurance experience.

✨ A passion for AI, data collection, or research projects.

✨ Ability to perform a variety of manual tasks (crafts, organizing, etc.).

✨ Experience playing video games and/or owning a Gamer PC.

💼 Important Information

📦 Equipment Provided: We supply all necessary recording gear (cameras, grippers, SD cards).

🗓 Time Commitment: While not mandatory, we are particularly interested in individuals who are willing to work at least 30 hours per week.

📍 Location: Mexico City - Remote (must be authorized to work in Mexico).

🔙 Onboarding: One-time, in-person training session required in Mexico City.

🔄 Duration: Variable, depending on project length. Flexible hours available.

📝 Freelance Opportunity: This is a freelance position, meaning no time-determinate contract.

👉 Apply Today & Be Part of the Future of AI!


Base pay is determined by multiple factors, including the area of expertise, years of experience, and skillset needed for the project. Pay rates vary during the project lifecycle. For example, rates for onboarding are lower.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of job opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

Title: Senior Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

As an Analytics Engineer at Trustpilot, you'll be a crucial bridge between our business and technical teams, directly influencing Analytics, Data Science, Data Engineering, and Product. You'll leverage our cutting-edge modern data stack to expand and enhance our data warehouse, empowering data-driven decisions across the organisation. This role offers the exciting opportunity to shape our data landscape and contribute to innovative analytics solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing


Maintain and evolve our data warehouse and business intelligence tool, providing reliable data access to users throughout Trustpilot
Design, build, maintain, and rigorously monitor robust data pipelines and transformative models using our modern data stack, including GCP, Airflow, dbt, and potentially emerging technologies like real-time streaming platforms
Develop and manage reverse ETL processes to seamlessly integrate data with our commercial systems, ensuring operational efficiency
Maintain and optimise our Customer Data Platform (CDP, ensuring effective data collection, unification, and routing
Administer and support our business intelligence tool, Looker, enabling users to provide insightful and user-friendly data visualisations
Identify opportunities to optimise our data warehouse and development methodologies, with the goal of reduced complexity, improved performance, and cost efficiency
Collaborate with Analysts and Data Scientists to prepare and model data for predictive analytics and AI/ML initiatives
Implement and maintain data observability and quality monitoring solutions, including custom alerting, to ensure the reliability and integrity of our data assets
Work closely with Engineering teams to understand their data needs, collaborate on data integration projects (e.g., web tracking via tracking plans), and build collaborative working relationships


Who You Are


You advocate a "data as a product" mindset, with a focus on documentation, rigorous reviews, and data accuracy
You are highly experienced in cloud data warehouses, modern data stacks, and best practices in data engineering
Your proficiency in SQL includes a wealth of experience in data manipulation, querying, and optimisation
You are curious, proactive, and interested in the impact of data and technology in business
You advocate for test-driven development and understand the critical role of high-quality data
Your communication and stakeholder management skills are highly skilled, allowing you to collaborate effectively across technical and non-technical teams
You can explain complex technical concepts clearly and succinctly
You thrive in cross-functional environments, working closely with Engineering, Data Science, and business teams
Experience with CDP and event tracking platforms like Segment or Hightouch, particularly in event tracking governance
Familiarity with observability tools, data quality monitoring, and data DevOps practices


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more
